Designed for the Karma Roleplaying System, Death's Shadow expands upon the vampire presented in Karmic Monsters to offer players and storytellers a wealth of material for their games. This product includes:

The nature of vampirism: The origins of vampires as explored in the Karma multiverse. How vampires are created. New templates (Vampire Spawn and Thrall).

Vampire variants: Example strains of vampirism. The Plague-tainted Bhutas, the magic-wielding Civatateos, the dream jumping Moroii, the seductive Mullos, the horrific Nosferatu, the sun-resistant Upyri, and the feral Vrykolakas.

Enemies of the undead: Allies for heroic players or enemies for vampire PCs. Dwarven Nightstalkers, paladins, vampire hunters, and werewolves. Plus the standard tools of the trade, from special alchemy items to holy water to stakes, and how to use them.

60623.name: Saikorojutsu! The Way of the Dice!
60623.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Saikorojutsu! The Way of the Dice! takes the Karma Core Rules and pushes them into overdrive, with 36 pages of advanced rules that let you replicate the feel of your favorite comics or anime adventures. Featuring:

Advanced Character Creation Rules: Create more powerful starting characters. Access Elemental Spirits to unlock unique powers in your characters.

Advanced Magic Rules: Take advantage of special Magical Path benefits. Craft more potent spells with few points by building Spell Groups. Maximize spell damage by taking advantage of elemental opposites.

For Warriors!: Get more out of your mana pool, with advanced rules that let you increase your speed, boost your attributes, and spontaneously heal damage. New weapons and special equipment. Plus two new disciplines: The Monk and the Gun-Fu master!

60624.name: The Burell Gang
60624.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In Nemesis V: The Burrell Gang, unleash an entire gang on your party. Carson Burrell was sold into slavery, only to kill his master and escape with his closest friends. Raised on the streets, he and his friends hold the world responsible for what happened in their childhood. And now everybody is gonna pay.

60625.name: The God of Sand and Storms
60625.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Has any real world mythological god appeared in more roleplaying game settings than Set? He’s stalked Africa in the RIFTS universe, caused chaos among the clans of Vampire: The Masquerade, and even found his way into Faerun and Ravenloft at various times. With the exception of the Devil himself, few mythical figures scream "evil" like Set.

But evil is such a...relative term.

Mythos: The God of Sands and Storms explores the Set mystique and presents an alternative history for storytellers and game masters looking to shake up their setting pantheons. As an entity that is the embodiment of necessary chaos, Set’s followers are less concerned with the abstract moral confines of good versus evil and instead focus their efforts on breaking down those institutions and powers that refuse to evolve. Dig deep into the root cause of the war between Horus and Set, and unlock the true mysteries of the Cult.

60626.name: RuneQuest Standard Edition
60626.description:
From the back of the box:
With RuneQuest, players create adventurers who explore an ancient world rich in magic. Everyone uses spells and anyone can be a warrior equipped with cold steel and stout armor. The gods provide fantastic powers to their mortal worhsippers and can intercede on their behalf. Each RuneQuest adventurer is unique, belonging to a definite culture and learning the crafts, trades, and skills of his or her parents.

RuneQuest is a fantasy roleplaying game for two or more players ages 12 or older.

Included in this box:

Rules Book (character generation, game system, combat, skills, creatures, gamemaster notes, adventurer sheet;
Spells Book (spirit magic, divine magic, sorcery)
Dice (2D20, 1D8, 1D6)

60628.name: Karmic Places: Blacktip Bay
60628.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Orc tribal settlement. Pirate Safe Harbor. Thriving Coastal Town. Blacktip Tip has evolved and is now beginning to experience growing pains. The old orcish traditions are beginning to clash with the current ecomonic-driven sensibilities of the growing populace. Honorable challenges give way to covert house wars, while the rule of the Chieftain is compromised by affluent merchants and his own Council.

Karmic Places: Blacktip Bay is a location sourcebook for the Karma Roleplaying System. Use Blacktip Bay as a launch point for new adventures, or as an exciting addition to your current campaign. This product provides the complete history of the town, geographic information, and general information regarding the different parts of town. Delve into the politics of the town. Don't agree with the way a Councilman is handling town affairs? Don't vote him out of office. Challenge him to a fight and take his seat! Need to earn some coin? Learn about the economics of the town and take up a bit of coral harvesting or go shark hunting. Unlock the mysteries of faith in the town by visiting the Temple of Apuk, the Great Shark. Or brave the wilds of the woods and mountains outside the town to visit the three great shrines and commune with the spirits there.

For Players: three new profession ideas, Six new gemstones with strange powers to maximize magical items, unique equipment, and three new disciplines (Apuk Devotee, Ranger, and Rogue).

For Storytellers: Six new monsters (blacktip reef shark, bone guardian, Chotha, jellyfish, mekuteye, muck tunneler), histories and stat blocks for a dozen NPCs (including the entire current Council and Chieftain) that can serve as allies or adversaries for the players, story seeds, and a magic item calculation guide that provides the construction data and retail prices of all magic items referenced in the book.

60629.name: Lords of the Manor
60629.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You know what they say about the best laid plans...

The Adventure Havens series continues with Lords of the Manor, a 30 page supplement packed full of locales and NPCs for use in your fantasy d20-style/3.5 games. Lords of the Manor presents 12 ready-to-use castles, keeps, and manor homes that can be dropped into almost any campaign. With NPCs ranging from CR 1 all the way up to CR 35, DM's will find plenty of side quests, plot devices, and challenges for their players!

Castles include:

Amberhurst Castle: Located on the harbor of a thriving merchant town that trades in amber. A perfect location and a congenial castellan make it ideal as a launch point for new campaigns.

Barcelton Manor: Having fallen into disrepair, a long lost heir seeks to restore it to its glory. Plotting, greedy neighboring lords have other plans.

Chelthenham Castle: A powerful archduke and his wizardly younger wife command this mountain fortress. Political intrigue abounds within the walls.

Flemming House: Once a private plantation, now a school for druids and nature-loving clerics and wizards to work together to study the natural world. Nearby ruins and treant teachers makes this an interesting stop for nature-oriented players.

Howling Hall: An abandoned tower deep in the forest, it is now home to a pack of werewolves and a ghost that still believes it is fighting off a vampire horde.

Icewing Hall: A frozen mountain castle that serves as home to a great wyrm dragon that is revered as a "dragon-god" by the barbaric tribes and loathed by other dragons...mostly because they didn’t come up with this scam first.

Lodentar Castle: Like some indestructible remnant of old wars, Lodentar castle stands as a gateway between two once rival nations.

Meadowbrook: A gnomish concentric castle...we need say more?

Stonetalon Keep: A solitary bastion of civilization in the middle of a desolate wasteland, stonetalon offers a welcome respite to weary adventurers.

Trelorforge Keep: This dwarven keep sits atop a rich iron mine, making it a source of steady income for the dwarves but also a potential target of greedy nobles that want to claim it for themselves.

Vesterdrew Manor: A pleasant farming community thrives thanks to the work of the Vesterdrew clan. But all is not well as a son’s new wife brings political maneuverings to the once peaceful manor.

Willow Keep Hill: Once known as Hangman’s Hill, the hill is now the home of a peculiar wizard and his ogre butler. A quiet neighbor according to the locals, except for the occasional "pet" escape.

Each Castle includes a detailed description along with history, important NPCs, and story seeds that can be used as plot devices or side quests. These locales provide you with quick and easy information that allows you to offer a players a new level of detail and depth to your campaign without extra effort.

60630.name: Eldarad: The Lost City
60630.description:
From the back of the book:

Now, all that remains of the city builders is a vast, chaos infested ruin, surrounded by rich tombs. Multitudes have come here seeking hidden wealth. Some have succeeded, but most, the failures, settled within the ruin. Over time, these people began a rebuilding in Eldarad. It is now a working ruin, devoid of law and order, where the minions of chaos walk freely in the night, preying on the dregs of society-Yet, still they come, the greedy and the innocent, seeking the tombs of the ancient builders, tombs rich in gold, and the magics of a race, long dead. For all the risks, one good find can make the searcher rich beyond dreams of avarice. The ship leaves tonight for Eldarad. Will you be on it to seek your fortune, or to delve into secrets, old beyond imagination? Decide with care, for the dangers are legion, and the rewards, incredible. GOOD LUCK, AND FAREWELL."

ELDARAD contains:

A 54 page book detailing the city and its dwellers,
A 62 page book on the lands around the city, and several fully detailed adventures.
A 32 page book of maps for Gamemaster use, and as player handouts.
An 11x16 game aids card, full of important charts and tables from the text.
An 11x16 full-color, painted map of the lands around Eldarad.
A 17x22 full color, painted map of Eldarad - This is the cardboard cover of the folder, opened out to twice original size.
Two 8 1/2x11 full-color maps of the Artisan's quarter and the Lost quarter.

60631.name: Factory
60631.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A compendium of magical computers, robots, and dweoware for your d20 campaign
I, Robot. You, Wormfood!

You, too, can make this threat if you're an 8' tall, elementally powered mithrium endoskeleton wrapped in 3 inch thick adamantium plates and sporting 360 degree vision, deflector screens, and turbo motivators while bringing a 15d8 delayed blast fireball online.

The arcane science of technomagic once again yields a terrifying crop: magical robots, dweonetics, and computers. From not-so-innocent beginnings as golems, the long history of technomagical development has resulted in the magical robot! And, to control these automatons demanded the invention of the arcane computer. From there, it was but a short leap to melding magical machine and man with dweonetics - arcane cybernetic devices implanted directly into living subjects!

60632.name: Arsenal
60632.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A compendium of magical firearms, explosives, and armor for your d20 campaign.

Between the covers of ARSENAL you will find hundreds of scientifically advanced magic weapons with a technological slant. Using them, you can:

Arm bug-hunting colonial marines of a star-faring society.

Support the modern battlefields with assault rifles and submachine guns.

Litter the apocalyptic wastelands with the dilapidated antiques of a preeminent past.

Tempt medieval warriors with antediluvian relics of astonishing power.

Provide that one remaining isolated pocket of an ancient civilization with the means to defend itself against the hordes of primitive adventurers seeking to despoil it.

60633.description: A one track (with 60 spaces from start to finish) game from The Road Traffic Directorate, meant to help children learn the traffic rules. The players roll a die and move forward as the die dictates. On a few spaces there are some instructions the players must follow. The first player to the finish space wins, but must recant one traffic rule and follow it from that time onwards.
60633.name: Umferðarspilið mitt

60634.name: Ardanyan's Revenge
60634.description:
From the back of the book:

Jealousy
When the Scourge was imminent, the people of the town of Ardanyan sought shelter in an underground kaer, expecting only the Horrors to be a threat. During the centuries of confinement, small quarrels grew into conflicts, which in turn developed into blood feuds and racial hatred. The Horrors would gladly have fed on Kaer Ardanyan - if they had only found it...

Bitterness
For generations, a secret society betrayed the unsuspecting citizens of Kaer Ardanyan. Now it struggles to keep its terrible secret. The player characters are the spark igniting a bonfire of intrigue, deceit and illusion. But the heroes have to be careful not to fall victim to the flames while on their dangerous quest to save the residents of a lost kaer!

Vengeance
Ardanyan's Revenge is an adventure supplement for Earthdawn Third Edition. Intended for Initiate and Novice characters of any Discipline, this book provides comprehensive information on starting and Earthdawn game for kaer-dwelling characters, but integrates easily into any running Earthdawn Campaign

60635.name: Servants of the Blood Moon
60635.description:
User Notes: An adventure for characters level 7-10

From the introduction:

Deep in the elven forest of Myereth, ancient rowan trees spread white boughs above a sacred site. Pillars of stone twist like some strange form of vine, curling among the branches and reflecting the light of a silvery moon. The forest is silent, and beautiful, protected since the dawn of time by a powerful Unicorn.

The elven forest of Myereth is well known throughout the world as a safe haven of good and peace, a place where evil cannot stand to enter and where the trees weep healing tears upon those injured within its boundaries. Any player character elves know of the forest, its healing properties, and its legendary beauty. They may have heard of it as a legend, or they may have visited its mystic shrine when they were children, brought among on a pilgrimage by other elves.

But something has gone terribly wrong.

60636.description: A deck of special power cards which are chosen at the beginning of a game. The point costs of the cards are subtracted from the scores at the end of the game.
60636.name: Duel in the Dark: Tactical Cards

60637.name: Princes, Thieves & Goblins

rpgissuearticle.84068: A Few Great Modules to Play

60637.description:
User Notes: For characters level 4-6.

From the introduction: In the 7th year of the reign of King Kessel V, in the kingdom of Antharp, in the shadow of the Silverbray Mountains, at the south end of Druna Pass, your search for adventure has led you to the sleepy town of Crow's Watch.

In the few days you have spent here, you have found that the people of Antharp were once prosperous and proud of their king, but recent events have brought the spirits of these vibrant people down. It all began when Herzl, court wizard and trusted advisor to King Kessel V, and his father before him, left the king's court for unknown reasons two years ago. Then, from the last spring planting to the autumn harvest, raids by renegade bands of goblins plundered the border communities of Antharp. Only the onset of winter stopped the goblins from further destruction, and all efforts to track and run the goblins to the ground have ended in failure.

But instead of the promise of rebirth and renewal that Spring thaw brings, this new year has brought only more bad news...the infant heir of King Kessel V, and only child has disappeared from within the castle.

60638.name: Earthdawn Journal (Issue 3 - Feb/Mar/Apr 1995)
60638.description:
Earthdawn Journal, Vol. 3
An Official Publication Devoted to Earthdawn FRPG

Cover art by Steve Bryant

60639.name: Garadon Manor
60639.description:
From the back cover:

This is a sequel to Out of Body, Out of Mind. This first adventure is not required, but is recommended to take full advantage of the alterante setting of Tirna'cel.

The legend of the realm of Tirna'cel is well known. Once remembered for its power-mongering warlords, homunculi-wielding sorcerers, and archfiends from the deepest pits of the Abyss, Tirna'cel has become a powerful and welcoming land over the last 600 years, due in no small part to the efforts of the warlor Tirna'gael, a member of the land's founding nobility.

But your party knows the truth. You ventured into the Tomb of Tiran'gael some six months ago, and therein discovered that the fallen warlord was actually little more than his brethren: a petty, avaricious power-monger. Possessed by a rival force which also desired the kingdom - a rare incorporeal demon called a nescent, which inhabited his body and augmented his already incredible power to unforeseen levels - Tirna'gael sought to overthrow the ancient warlords only to replace them.

Through Tirna'gael's augmented body, the nescent overwhelmed and eliminated the other warlords, eventually dominating the realm alone. But before it could consolidate its rule and throw Tiran'cel into an even darker age, the secret of its power was discovered by the paladins of Garadon, a virtuous cell of justice and light. The paladins lured Tiran'gael into the center of his own fortress and trapped him there within a powerful antimagic field. His body withered and died but the nescent remained dormant, waiting for its chance for revenge.

During your visit to Tirna'gael's fortress-tomb six months ago, you accidentally released the nescent from its prison. That enemy has since been vanquished - at least for the time being - but the memory of your pitched battle against it still lingers as you approach the original chapter house of the Order of Garadon.

You have been summoned.

60640.name: Earthdawn Journal (Issue 7 - Jul 1996)

rpgissuearticle.55863: And the Path Shall Be Perilous

60640.description:
Earthdawn Journal, Vol. 7
An Official Publication Devoted to Earthdawn FRP

Cover art by Janet Ausilio

60641.name: Dawn of the Serpent
60641.description:
User Notes: For characters levels 5-7.

From the introduction (spoiler): Travel always has its hazards. Inclement weather, roving bandits, and the occasional monster all take their toll. In the PC's case, they are about to encounter all three.

The Gloamwood Forest is shrouded in mystery and local legend. Tales of petrified animals, giant spiders, and lost caravans are spread by the local peasants. However the dire stories are mostly passed off as superstition by educated members of society. Though strange disappearances do occur from time to time, the road through Gloamwood Forest is still widely used by merchants and travelers.

60642.name: Bring Him Back Alive!
60642.description:
User Notes: For characters level 1-4.

Back Cover:

It's a warm summer evening, just about perfect. A cool breeze blusters in from the northwest, carrying the promise of the encroaching autumn with it, but at the moment it brings you a welcome relief from the heat of the day.

After spending most of your summer delving into the deeps and dungeons beneath the land, you're just happy to be able to relax in the comforts of a world in which the sun sets and rises. For what seems like the first time in ages, you're not so worried about what might be lurking just around the corner or behind the next door as you are about the terrible prospect of draining dry the local tavern's stores.

You have just finished a marvelous dinner at the Stumble Inn. (The weathered wooden sign creaking over a lump of gold.) The innkeeper and his wife - Carbad and Kamalda, an honest pair of retired farmers as weatherbeaten as their place's sign - have hauled out their very best for you. They know that you are restless to be on your way and that they aren't bound to have the pleasure of your company for much longer.

Just as you are about to raise a toast to you deserving host, a rumpled shape staggers through the inn's open door.

You reach for your weapon, startled at the intrusion, but before you can act, the figure crumples to the floor. The innkeeper dashes over and turns the stricken stranger onto his back. "Marcaeus!" he gasps, then looks back up at you, his face filled with dread.

You rush to the fallen man's side. He's alive, but barely so. He's literally been beaten within an inch of his life, and his right leg is twisted at a decidedly uncomfortable angle.

You roll the man over onto his back, and he groans loudly as the bones in his battered leg crunch together. His eyes flicker for a moment and then open wide. His gaze, clouded by his intense pain, fixes directly on you.

Just before he mercifully passes out, he reaches up and grabs you by the front of your shirt.

"My son," he whispers through his battered lips, "they've got my son!"

60644.name: Kraina Bajek and Leśne Przygody
60644.description:
On the one side of the board, you make your way through the land of fairy tales. Hansel and Gretel, Queen, Cinderella, Red Riding Hood, Puss and Boots and others. Beware the Snow Queen - she will send you back! Roll the dice and move your colored pawns around the board.

Reverse the board and play Forest Adventure. Drive through the woods - full of fire, litter and tasty mushrooms.

Designed by Jan Krukowski and published by F P H VIP/ MB Studio

60645.name: The Redwood Scar
60645.description:
From the title page: An Introductory Blackmoor Adventure for 4-6 Characters of 2nd-4th Level

From the introduction:
The Redwood Scar is an adventure for Dave Arneson’s Blackmoor designed for four to six player characters (PCs) of 2nd through 4th level. The action takes place in the Redwoods and involves the PCs stopping an insidious evil from perverting the forest. While the characters can be of any race and class, a druid, ranger and/or a Cumasti elf are particularly appropriate. See the "Scaling Information" section to tailor this adventure for larger or smaller groups and/or those of higher or lower level. Boxed text should be paraphrased or read aloud to the players.

60646.name: Temple of the Frog
60646.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to The Temple of the Frog, the latest version of the oldest published fantasy adventure. For 30 years, adventurers have lived in awe and fear of this mythical dungeon deep within the forbidding waters of the Great Dismal Swamp. Now, you have the opportunity to do the same. This product provides you with not only information on the Temple itself, but also on the small swamp town of Boggy Bottom, where the player characters can base their forays against the vicious Cult of the Frog. In addition, there’s a wealth of new magic items, technology, and monsters, all of which will help make this adventure one that players and Game Masters alike should long remember.

This chapter has several sections, all designed to aid the DM in running the adventure. The first is an overview of the Cult of Brr’bb’t, more popularly known as the Cult of the Frog, and its nefarious plans. The second is a discussion of the Travelers, an enigmatic group of beings whose actions have been subtly influencing events in the North for some time. Next is a brief overview of ways to involve the PCs, providing the DM with several different ways that he could get the PCs involved. Finally, there is an extended description of Boggy Bottom and its inhabitants, as well as several events that can be used therein.

60647.name: Parallel Dual! Ultimate Fan Guide
60647.description:
This is another fan guide/RPG setting book from Guardians of Order.

This book is slimmer than most of their RPG/fan guides, and requires the main Big Eyes. Small Mouth 2nd Edition book if you want to use the game information to run a game.

From the introduction:

Dual! chronicles the adventures of a 16 year old high school student, Kazuki Yotsuga, who finds himself transported to a parallel Japan. In his home world, Kazuki's classmates mock him for the visions of giant battling robots only he sees. In the parallel world, he discovers that these robots are real and are fighting a war for world domination, using his home city for a battleground. He also learns that he is the only male in the parallel world who can pilot the giant mecha, which makes him an important asset to both sides - and places him in great danger.

60648.name: In Labyrinthen - Dunkle Pfade im Osten
60648.description:
Dunkle Pfade im Osten

Translated from the back of the book:
This booklet collects some classical, but revised, adventures from the dawn of the Cthulhu roleplaying game with a new scenario of a German author. The additional texts contain not only information about Indian shamans but also lots of Mythos book excerpts which offer the possibility to connect the adventures to a campaign.

Contents:

Introduction
Myths, Shamans and Magical Personalities

Sceanrios (incl. German titles):
The warren ("Das Nest")
The case ("Der Fall")
The horrible lonely house in the woods ("Das entsetzlich einsam gelegen Haus im Wald")
Furious Driving ("Autonarren")
The pale god ("Der Gott im Labyrinth")

60649.name: Hammers, Anvils, and Tongs
60649.description:
From the publisher:

Sometimes even getting your armor repaired can lead to adventure! With Adventure Havens: Hammers, Anvils, and Tongs, introduce your players to twelve weaponsmiths, bowyers, and leatherworkers that can do more than buy unwanted gear. Variant materials to customize armor and weapons, and new rules for dragon skin armor!

60650.name: Library Lore
60650.description:
From the publisher:

Whoever said libraries were boring never visited these! Adventure Havens: Library Lore presents twelve ready-to-use libraries that can be dropped into almost any fantasy setting. Now when your players stop to do research, learn new spells, or uncover lost lore, they might find a lot more than they bargained for among those books.

60651.name: Tavern Tales
60651.description:
From the publisher:

You know it wouldn't be a proper trip in town if the party didn't stop at the local tavern. But what exactly can they expect besides a mug of ale? Adventure Havens: Tavern Tales presents twelve generic taverns full of rowdy, conniving, plotting NPCs ready to use your players in their schemes.

60652.name: Dragon (Issue 41 - Sep 1980)
60652.description:
Vol. V No. 3 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by James Holloway.

This issue contained a pull-out section with an AD&D adventure, "The Halls of Beoll-Dur", labeled M-1 to M-16.

60653.name: Stein der Anklage
60653.description:
User Summary:

Many hundred Years ago, the mages were driven from the countries of mortal men. Many died, but the survivors fled to the lands of Bekal-Burudos.

This is the first of two books, which describe a long campaign for your heroes.

Universal-Fantasy-Setting with Stats for AD&D, DSA and Midgard.

60654.name: Sieben Sonnen
60654.description:
User Summary:

Many hundred Years ago, the mages were driven from the countries of mortal men. Many died, but the survivors fled to the lands of Bekal-Burudos.

This is the second of two books, which describe a long campaign for your heroes.

Universal-Fantasy-Setting with Stats for AD&D, DSA and Midgard.

60655.name: Dragon (Issue 42 - Oct 1980)
60655.description:
Vol. V No. 4 of Dragon Magazine.

Cover Art by Steve Oliff.

This issue contained a pull-out section with an AD&D adventure, "The Mansion of Mad Professor Ludlow: A spooky AD&D adventure", labeled A-1 to A-16.

60657.name: Bee-Siege
60657.description:
The Bees aren’t happy! For some reason, there’s a poor pollen crop this year and Winter is fast approaching. Reluctantly, Queen Yellow-Tail signals her swarm, “Sneak over to the neighbour’s and seize some of their flowers”. But Queen Brown-Eyes has a few ideas of her own…

Bee-Siege is a two-player game of strategic positioning, lasting eight rounds (allow one hour to play). Players co-ordinate their small swarm of Bumblebees, Queens, Honeybees and Workers by selecting order tiles from a shared pool. The player with the most points at game’s end is the winner.

Note: No Bees will be harmed during the course of play!

60659.name: Gods of Nature
60659.description:
From the publisher:

The Mythos series continues with Gods of Nature. This 10 pg PDF introduces three new open game content gods that can be dropped into almost any d20-style fantasy setting.

Alenadra Thousand Eyes: Known as The Weaver, Alenadra understands the intricate relationships of all living creatures. To mortals, her movements seem chaotic and capricious. But her followers know that she sees patterns in the natural order others cannot.

Bibilbilob: This ancient water elemental's interference in mortal ventures on the seas has earned it godhood by accident. Now it goes by a dozen names and masquerades as various regional gods to further study the actions of mortals for its own unknown ends.

Casnilianop the Shambler: An ageless plant creature that has slowly ascended to godhood, Casnilianop is known by dozens of names around the world. Determined to protect the natural world, its followers will resort to any means required to follow the commands of their patron.

This product includes:

Descriptions of each divine being, information on their churches, and how they interact with society.
New Feats: Cresting Wave, Plant Attunement, Photosynthesis, Spider Senses, and Water Attunement
New Spells: Calm Waters, Life Root, Salt Spray, Transmute Earth to Water, Weave Walk
New Creatures: Scarecrow and Weave Spider
All in a compact, printer-friendly PDF.

boardgamehonor.12418: 2010 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee

60660.name: Hamsterrad
60660.description: Hamsterrad is a board game in which the players dive into realistic everyday life situations. They experience financial problems, like expenditures, high debts, e.g. rising, short-time work or divorce and learn to master these situations. The goal is to reduce the debts and amass sufficiently liquidity for reserves.

60662.name: Gods of Wealth and Greed
60662.description:
From the publisher:

In Mythos: Gods of Wealth and Greed, we introduce you to three all new open content gods concerned with the coins of the realms.

The Benevolent Stranger, God of Philanthropy, seeks to encourage the wealthy to go out and do good.

Bizen, God of Bankers, slowly transforms the commerce of major cities.

Kariharra, Goddess of Gems, hordes her wealth and her power of the jewelers and gem cutters, gaining a surprising amount of power in the process.

This product includes:

New domain--Wealth
New Spell--Supreme Creation
New Wondrous Items--Appraising Dust, Bizen's Seal, Shield of Benevolence, Token of Benevolence, and Wand of Mysteries
Stats for the half-celestial silver dragon Thareanatria, leader of the church of Kariharra and alleged granddaughter of the goddess.

60663.name: The Principled Assassin
60663.description:
From the publisher:

What this product is:
While the assassin is a legitimate, playable prestige class, game masters trying to maintain some semblance of believability in their games often have a hard time justifying an assassin player character in the party. A game master might refuse to allow the class because he doesn't want to run an "evil" campaign, or out of fear that the class will clash with other party members. Players too, might shy away from the opportunity to play an assassin class in a campaign world where it is not clear what role the assassin plays (if there is one at all).

The Principled Assassin discusses the Church of Galenen, an open game content deity of assassins. But Galenen's church is more complicated that just your typical den of murderers, and the faith serves a legitimate role (of sorts) in the greater society. This product provides details regarding how Galenen came to power, the evolution of his Church, and how his followers can function in society. This product is designed to be detailed enough to provide a new level of depth while remaining generic enough to fit into almost any campaign.

The Principled Assassin touches briefly on events first referenced in Gods of the Dead, in which we introduced four open game content deities of death and undeath. However the history presented can be easily tweaked to work in your own campaigns. The references to the Great Reckoning can be ignored or altered as needed to fit Galenen into your campaign world.

Ultimately, this product offers you a ready-made mythos and institution to drop into your game setting to add a new level of detail to the world.

What this product isn't:
There are no new classes or prestige classes, and only a handful of new spells. There are other products available that already do a fine job of offering a host of new spells and magic items for assassin characters. We felt no need to recreate the wheel by creating a bunch of new magic items and spells that simply duplicate effects already available to the player.

60664.name: Gods of the Dead
60664.description:
From the introduction:

Gods of the Dead presents four new completely open game content deities of death and undeath that can be dropped into virtually any d20-style campaign setting. Vagruth and his sons hold responsibility over all aspects of death, dying, and undeath, and their unique relationship can be added to any setting to provide plot devices or a quick back-story for your world. Instead of just providing a bunch of game mechanics to incorporate into a game, Gods of the Dead also offers you a mythology to add more depth to your fantasy setting.
Two of the deities, Vagruth and Nadru, are presented with two sets separate descriptions, allowing you to decided how you want to introduce them into your game. Is death a terrifying notice, and the god of death a malevolent force in your world? Or is death considered part of the natural order, and the god of death is an indifferent but fair being? The choice is yours.

60665.name: Blessed Ladies of Law
60665.description:
From the introduction:

Blessed Ladies of Law presents three new completely open game content deities of law that can be dropped into virtually any d20-style campaign setting. This trinity of goddesses often simultaneously find themselves on the same side, while being at odds with each other. All three believe that laws are meant for the betterment of society, and that people are better off following the law. Also, all three believe those impacted by those who break the law should be protected and have a right to seek amends from those that wronged them. However, it is in how they handle wrongdoing that they differ. Calana, goddess of Justice, seeks to insure fairness in trial but also uphold the punishments administered by the courts. Dalana, goddess of Vengeance, tracks down those who have avoided punishment or who, in her opinion, were not punished enough. Finally, Elana, goddess of Mercy, seeks to rehabilitate wrongdoers so that they can become productive members of society.
Use these goddesses singularly or as a group, depending on your campaigns needs.

60666.name: The Animae
60666.description:
From the most primitive tribes to the most cosmopolitan cities, the notion that all things possess an awareness and can be called upon for aid is a popular one. While the gods are revered for their raw power, most commoners pay only lip service to them. The gods, while often active in the affairs of humanity, rarely interest themselves with the day-to-day needs of the people. In many cultures, worship of household spirits and personal gods is widespread. These spirits, known collectively as The Animae, number in the tens of thousands. Though not true gods, they have a direct impact on the day-to-day existence of those they watch over. From preventing food from spoiling to keeping a drinking well clean, their duties may be mundane in scope but vital to the survival of a family.
Mythos: The Animae, explains the nature of these strange spirits, from how they come to be to the powers they possess. Learn how to design customized Animae for your campaign, or even allow players to create their own guardian spirits.

60667.name: Vampires
60667.description:
From the publisher:

Five ready to unleash vampiric villians to use, plus a bonus villian. Marcos Hayden, the Vampire Lord. Hayden's network of contacts expands the entire continent. His ultimate goal? Nothing less than bringing the god of the dead to the prime material plane! Illustrated by Morrigana, you can get a sneak peek of Hayden on her site.

60668.name: Serial Killers
60668.description:
From the publisher:

Your heroes have faced supernatural beasts, cybernetic monstrosities, alien forces...and somehow survived. But what if the greatest threat to their lives wasn't some superhuman ninja, but the well-dressed gentleman on the bus that just asked for the time? Or that sweet country girl that offered them ride?

In Nemesis II: Serial Killers, we present 5 ready-to-use NPCs complete with histories, victim profiles, signatures, story seeds, and character portraits for use in your d20 style modern campaigns. Let your heroes cross paths with these all-too-human monsters and unravel the clues to bring them to justice.

60669.name: Corporate Villains
60669.description:
From the publisher:

When the corporate bottom line is written in blood, will your heroes be able to even the odds? In Nemesis III: Corporate Villains, meet 5 new NPCs who give new meaning to the phrase "cutthroat business." Each NPC comes complete with backgrounds, story seeds, and multiple stat sets to allow them to easily integrate into your game.

60670.name: Nature's Avengers
60670.description:
From the publisher:

Not all of nature's defenders are benign. Some defend the land for their own ends, hoping to prevent the encroachment of civilization from destroying their own peace. Others seek to even the odds against their human kin that abuse the land. In Nemesis IV: Nature's Avengers, we introduce you to five defenders of the land with their own agendas. From a cannibalistic priest/sea captain to a fallen paladin turned barbarian, each fully developed NPC includes a background, story seeds, recommended dialogue, and multiple stat sets.

60671.name: Baba Yaga: The First Setting in Rassiya

rpghonor.14050: 2006 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Gold Winner

60671.description:
From the Publisher:

The world's most famous witch awaits you! Step inside the land of Rassiya,and experience the folklore of a cold, northern land where nothing is quite as it seems. Living dolls spin perplexing riddles. Foul spirits lurk in cold swamps. Talking wolves lure unwary travelers deep into forbidding forests. And there, at the heart of darkness, lives the black-toothed hag Baba Yaga and her chicken-legged hut.

Will she aid you in your journey, or devour your living soul?

This sourcebook contains: maps that cover the land of Rassiya; a detailed description of the town of Derevnya, giving adventurers a base of operations for exploring the land around them; never-before-seen monsters based on real Eastern European folklore; a brand-new playable PC race, the Lebedinoe; randomized charts for generating traps and magical items on the fly; and an in-depth look at Baba Yaga herself.

60672.name: Flight of the Firebird: The Second Setting in Rassiya
60672.description:
From The Publisher:

Journey back to Rassiya, the russian-inspired fantasy setting began by author Michael Fiegel, now continued by writers Sylvia Feketekuty, Jason Black and Sean C. Frolich.

Time has not been kind to the kingdom of Rassiya. Decay eats at the very walls of the city, and unrest whispers in the streets like dry leaves in the cold wind.

The forest is dying, and old men are seeing visions of great birds, wrought of molten gold.

Contains legendary characters Koschei the Deathless and the Firebird, as well as a new template 'False Immortal'. Sample expressions and dialogue, plot hooks, magic items and treasure make this book a great addition to the Folkloric line.

60673.name: The Festival of Blades

rpgsetting.3881: Neiyar: Land of Heaven and the Abyss

60673.description:
From the publisher:

A full module for the Neiyar: Land of Heaven and the Abyss Campaign setting. This module debuted last June at the Origins Game Convention. Designed for 8th-12th level characters, this high-powered game focuses on the annual Festival of Blades, a sacred gladitorial style combat held in the city of Delansha. Warriors from around the island travel to the city for the chance to compete for the grand prize, the title of Kalguardia and a power weapon known as the Blade of Kalla.

While entrants know there is a chance to die during the combat, noone was prepared when entrants started turning up dead BEFORE the festival even began. Explore the city to uncover clues as to who is killing off combatants and why, before the PC's themselves become the next victims! Experience the thrill of the arena and discover all of the side-quests throughout the city. Also includes additional weapons designed specifically for the Festival. Newly revised edition includes a full color map of the city.

60674.name: Dan Qi
60674.description: Dan Qi is an ancient Chinese game dating back to at least the Han dynasty. The exact rules and design of the pieces/board have only been recovered in fragments, but many scholars speculate on what the game actually looked and how it was actually played. Some scholars believe that the game is dexterity-focused, where players take turn flicking pieces at each other. Others believe the game may involve playing with pieces hidden in a manner similar to Lu Zhan Jun Qi. Still others think that the game had some sort of religious application and involved dropping the pieces randomly onto a special diviniatory board.

60676.name: Neiyar: The Ruins of Dazu

rpgsetting.3881: Neiyar: Land of Heaven and the Abyss

60676.description:
From the publisher:

Six Centuries ago, the great Krakodonian capital of Dazu was destroyed, and with it the heart and soul of the Krakodonian empire. Since then, the race has fallen apart, with warring clans struggling for dominion over each other. The once great empire has been carved into fiercely defended territories. But factions are forming that seek to rebuild the empire anew, and new battle lines are drawn to see who will earn the right to reclaim the lost city, and with it command of the race.

Neiyar: The Ruins of Dazu, takes you into the heart of the former capital. The Shaman, astrologers, and Wise Ones have been receiving visions of a strange orb somewhere in the ruins, and they believe it may be the key to forever vanquishing the mighty dragon that prowls the ruins and thus reclaiming the city. But is the orb truly the key to victory, or is something else in play?

Explore the once great capital. Fight against the monsters that lurk within the shattered walls. Outwit other clans that are also seeking the orb. And above all else, avoid the great dragon that prowls the area, for he will not take kindly to those who seek to remove a treasure from his domain.

60677.name: Challenges and Rewards
60677.description:
From the publisher:

Challenges and Rewards, by Josh Benton, offers a concise alternative experience system to reward players for resolving situations without combat. This easy-to-use PDF provides a simple formula for calculating XP for non-combat challenges, as well as advice on when to use the system.

60678.name: Dem Bones
60678.description:
Cover Blurb: A new character and Storytelling Adventure System scene for Geist: The Sin Eaters.

From the introduction:

"Dem bones, dem bones gonna walk all over, dem bones, dem bones they gonna walk all over..." The thing in Regan’s head was still singing that damn song. It hadn’t stopped in three months, ever since the Incident had bound them together. Not to breathe, not to eat, not to sleep--not even to let her do any of those things. You might not think something as simple as a song on continuous repeat could drive someone completely insane; surely that’s the sort of thing you could tune out after a while, like traffic noise or a waterfall right outside your window. You’d be wrong, and Regan would be happy to tell you so.

"Please," Regan whispered softly, her eyes squeezed shut and her body rocking softly back and forth, like a child in her mother’s lap. "I can’t live like this. Just... just give me an hour. Ten minutes. Five. God, please, anything you want, I’ll do it, just please be quiet!"

"Dem bones, dem bones gonna walk all over, dem bones, dem bones they gonna walk all over..." Regan’s breath caught in a ragged little hiccup, somewhere halfway between a sob and a hysterical laugh. "Fine," she said, opening her eyes as her gaze settled on the gun in her lap. "Okay. We’ll do it this way." Tears tumbling down her cheeks, she drew in a deep breath and brought the gun to her temple.

Some hours later, after her blood and brains had cooled and congealed, Regan sat up with a sudden, rasping hiss of breath. She saw a boy’s face, not much older than her, and she knew that he had been killed for the seventeen dollars in his wallet and the hundred dollar shoes on his feet before she could tear the caul away. Blinking slowly, as though she’d never seen the world before, Regan smiled and began to sing.

"Dem bones, dem bones gonna walk all over, dem bones, dem bones they gonna walk all over..."

60679.name: De Bello Britannico
60679.description:
From the back of the book (translated from German):

Angel against heretic. Swords against cannons.

The warriors of the Holy Mother Church wage war against a culture that is even stranger to them than they had expected. This book invites you to explore the British isles – either as a pious Angeletic, or as a ghost-worshipping Briton. Furthermore, the abilities, powers and the history of the fallen Order of Sarielites are finally unveiled in this book. De Bello Britannico describes the battles and the course of the Angeletic conquest campagin, and contains all information you need to join in this historic events together with your group – as an Angel, Templar or steadfast islander.

The war has started. Who will triumph?

60681.name: Kanga Winks
60681.description:
Kanga-winks is a tiddly-winks style game from by Avon (ding-dong! Avon calling!) with a kangaroo-shaped bottle of bubble bath.

The bottle has a plastic pouch that awards extra points for potting the wink within it.

60682.description:
GiftTRAP Lite is a quick simple filler card game themed around giving gifts. Unlike the full board game, which is focused on two dimensions (giving and getting), this is a card game focused on simply giving gifts that people like. It is also suited to playing in teams, unlike the board game which is very much about you, the individual.

GiftTRAP lite is played over a series of rounds where players/teams take turns to be the judge and receive gits from their friends. This is a game where less really is more. Each player can give 1, 2 or 3 gifts (as a collection). The judge must decide which collection is best. Giving just 1 gift will get you three points, two gifts = two points and three gifts just one point, so the better you know the judge the more likely you can win more points with less cards.

The winner is the player/team with the most points after each player/team has been the judge twice.

This game is produced as a standalone game, that also happens to double as an expansion to the main game simply because the gifts included can be combined with the main game. You can of course play this game with the contents from the original game.
60682.name: GiftTRAP Lite

60683.description:
Sambaschule was bundled with the limited edition of Cuba (wooden cigar box) at "Spiel 2007" in Essen.

As you can see on the tile, the building costs 2 wood (white) and 2 stone (red) cubes.
60683.name: Cuba: Sambaschule

60684.name: Mater Ecclesia
60684.description:
From the back of the book (translated from German):

All over Europe, mere mortals strife to do the Lord’s will – whatever it may be. For this, they cannot build on heavenly powers; instead, they trust in God’s mercy and the skills they have been taught during their education. Whether it is in the isolation of a monastery at the edge of civilization, in the busy crowds of an Order’s metropolis, in the focus of attention of many or under the seal of secrecy – without the mortal servants of the holy Mother Church, life in Europe in the 27th century could not be imagined.
Mater Ecclesia reveals the way of life, the dogmas and rites of the servants of the church, tells of secrets that only known to a handful of initiates and makes the heroes in the shadows of the Engel real to the players.
Various hooks for exciting stories await you in the pages of this book. Stories, that will enhance the atmosphere of your Engel chronicle and allow for views of the mechanisms of the greatest institutes the world has ever seen.

60685.name: Adventurer Sheets: Human
60685.description:
Official Two-Color RuneQuest Forms.

From the back of the box:
This box contains three types of adventurer sheets. The first is intended for use in creating male human adventurers. The second is intended for use in creating Female human adventurers. These forms include a sketch of either a male or a female figure. Players can personalize this sketch to illustrate their adventurer.

There is also a Generic sheet suitable for use in creating either male or female adventurers. This generic sheet can also be used in creating characters of any species that use human-style hit locations.

60686.description:
This game was developed in 1997 by the Lockheed Martin Ethics Awareness Training Development Task Force in cooperation with United Featured Syndicate. The game is a component of employee ethics training.

The game uses a game board, character figures based on the Dilbert comic strip and a team guidebook.

Players are divided into 2 to 6 teams of 3 to 7 people and are led through a series of ethical case studies. A simple ethical situation is presented along with 4 possible responses. The teams must decide which is the correct response and present it to the group. Answers provide that team with movement points between 0 and 5 -- better answers grant more points. The teams then use their points to move their figure around the board an collect reward tokens. After 5 cases are answered, the game is over and the winner is the team with the most tokens.

The real objective is "to stimulate thought, discussion, and analysis of the issues that we all must deal with in our work."
60686.name: The Ethics Challenge featuring Dilbert and Dogbert

60687.name: Adventurer Sheets: Nonhuman
60687.description:
Official Two-Color RunQuest Forms.

From the back of the box:
This package contains adventurer sheets for nine nonhuman species: broos, centaurs, ducks, dwarfs, elves, halflings, ogres, orcs, and trolls. The base skill precentiles for each of these sheets are tailored to the appropriate species. New skills have been added where needed. Each sheet also includes a sketch of a typical memeber of that species that players can complete to illustrate their nonhuman adventurer.

Additionally, there is a multiple-hit location sheet. This form lacks any species sketch, but instead provides many lines for hit locations and number tallies to record each location's hit points.

60688.name: Witchcraft
60688.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Hidden in the shadows of the Colonies are many evil things. Monsters stalk the night, people swear oaths to dark powers, and Agents of the Occult & Supernatural work to harm all. One group feared and whispered about are Witches. Though some feel that the legends of Witches and Witchcraft are nothing more than just that, legends, some know the truth. Witches live and Witches desire to harm all.

Colonial Gothic: Witchcraft is your guide to this threat. With new rules, and expanded background, this sourcebook is ready for you to add dark threats and vile creations in your games.

In addition to the new rules, included is an excerpt from one of the most important works in the history of Witchcraft: King James VI Daemonologie. Written to prove that witchcraft not only existed but thrived. Written in three parts, the work is a dialogue between two figures who discuss and debate not only the existence of Witches, but also of the influence Satan has on the world. When King James became King James I of a united Scotland and England, a new edition of his work was published in 1603.

New magic, new threats, and new ideas. Do you dare study a threat to the Colonies?

60689.name: Sin Eater
60689.description:
User Summary: Demo adventure available as pdf.

From the introduction (spoilers): This demo is designed for Colonial Gothic. It is set in the town of Trenton, New Jersey, and the action revolves around the players looking into the disappearances and eventually confronting the vampire known as Livingstone. This demo can be run in 30-mminutes, or extended to two hours.

60690.name: Codex Urbanis
60690.description:
From the back of the book (translated from German):

In the world of Engel, city air makes you free too – at least from the apparently ever-present influence of the Angelitic Church. The Codex Urbanis shines a light on the cities of the Junklords, who have created their own little empires on the rubble of ancient cities, and who resist the Church’s claim to sole power.
Supported by antediluvian finds, forbidden knowledge and treasures found amidst the ruins of the cities, they attempt to stand on their own. The guns and other techonological advances held by their armies and warbands keep even the Engels of the Lord in check.

This book describes countless Diadochs in all their variations from an enlightened doubter to a despot drunk on power, and opens new character options to expand the world of Engel. It deals with the common aspects of life and the circumstances in the church-free cities and offers a glimpse of the forbidden technologies that are at the power of the Junklords.

60692.name: The Royal Geographical Amusement or the Safe and Expeditious Traveller Through all the Parts of Europe by Sea and by Land
60692.description: A game for the improvement of geography. The journey started in Calais and the ending square, number 103, was placed in London. A spin the gambling top and move game.

60694.name: Die Kreaturen des Schwarzen Auges
60694.description:
User summary:
Describes the plants and animals of Aventurien. It offers

stats for monsters
rules and stats for plants
rules and stats for domestic player animals
random event tables for journeys
random town/village creation

60695.name: Fushigi Yûgi Book #2
60695.description:
User summary

Fushigi Yûgi is a 52-episode comedy-drama anime series in which two modern-day Japanese teenagers are thrown into a fantasy world based on ancient Japan.

This Ultimate Fan Guide covers episodes 14-26 of the Fushigi Yûgi series. The book describes each episode and the appearing characters as well as the background setting. Also included are BESM (Big Eyes, Small Mouth) attributes, defects, skill costs, items and NPC and character stats.

60696.name: 50 New Ways to Turn Things into Other Things: Transmutation

rpgissuearticle.150934: 50 New Ways to Turn THings Into Other Things

60696.description:
From the introduction:

A Book for Characters and Players
All the flavor text contained in this book is written in with the idea that Fifty New Ways to Turn Things into Other Things is not only available to the players, but also to their characters. A character can buy this book, prepare the spells from it, and gain knowledge of the flavor text. The spellbook is written by Starlanko the Magnificent, a powerful wizard and experienced salesman who lives in a generic fantasy world. Details for the cost of Fifty New Ways to Turn Things into Other Things in your campaign world can be found on another sidebar.

The flavor text is also designed to spark campaign ideas for adventures and NPCs. The names of kingdoms or historical events can be easily changed to reflect your campaign setting.

Introduction
Greetings and thank you for purchasing Fifty New Ways to Turn Things into Other Things: Starlanko the Magnificent’s Book of Transmutation. I, of course, am Starlanko the Magnificent.

This is the second book in the Fifty New Ways to... series. For years I sold spells one at a time. I dreamed of compiling a collection such as this, but since each wizard’s arcane writings are different, such mass production was difficult. Until now. Thanks to a revolutionary spell notation system you can easily prepare spells directly from this book without transferring it to your own book. If you enjoyed this volume, you may wish to pick up a copy of my previous text, Fifty New Ways to Blow Stuff Up, and keep you eyes peeled for future installments.

60697.description:
Atlantic Triangle is a trading game for 2 - 5 players, who travel the seas as captains of merchant fleets in the dawn of the 18th century.

The Atlantic Ocean and the three continents conjoined by it lay the scene for fierce competition for money and power. The players seek to strengthen their trading stature by defying storms, pirates and competitors, who are pursuing the same goal.

A canny merchant keeps track of the market and the developments in supply and demand, and has the courage to take risks in the pursuit of greatness.

The Players purchase ships, load them with products and sail the three continents selling and trading their products, building bases, evading pirates and defying storms.

The winner of the game is decided by victory cards. Victory cards can be acquired via purchasing and maintaining bases, and by hunting down pirates. Different combinations of victory cards are worth different numbers of victory points.

Victory cards are drawn from the top of a shuffled deck, randomizing the type of a card the players get. The player who first acquires victory cards worth ten victory points wins the game.
60697.name: Atlantic Triangle

60698.name: Snowflake
60698.description:
From the introduction – “An assortment of interesting puzzles and games based on a mathematically closed set of ten pieces and a clever but sometimes frustrating base.”

The pieces are each three or four hexagons jointed in various combinations to create ten different shapes. The most interesting game in the group is called Glacier. Players take turns either placing a piece on the base or moving one that is already positioned. All empty spaces must remain connected. It is not legal to close off an area. The last player to make a legal move is the winner.

The puzzles are generally of the Tangrams type.

60699.name: Pasang
60699.description:
In Pasang, a traditional game of Brunei, black and white tokens are arranged on a playing board, forming a pattern. There is a catalogue of more than 30 different patterns. Many of these patterns resemble embroideries commonly seen on kain songket or kain tenun, Brunei's traditional cloth.

Two players take turn capturing these tokens, scoring 1 point for each black token and 2 points for each white one. The game ends when the board is empty, or when a player runs out of moves.

Pasang is commonly played during celebrations of royal weddings and the annual birthday festival of the Sultan of Brunei.

60700.name: The Flag Game
60700.description:
Flag consists of deck of 60 cards, each depicting a different national flag, and 76 tickets. 60 tickets bear the name of a country, 11 show stars and stripes, four show a pirate flag, and one flag of truce.

The 60 are initially dealt out evenly to all players. Then players take turns, randomly drawing a ticket. If the ticket contains the name of a country, the player who holds the flag of that country places it the middle of the table. If the ticket shows stars and stripes, the player captures all the flags that have been placed in the middle. If the ticket shows a pirate flag, the player who drew the ticket returns all his captured flags to the middle. The game ends when all tickets have been drawn. Whoever drew the flag of truce card, captures all flags that remain in the middle. The winner is the player with the most flags.

60703.name: My European Vacation
60703.description:
The learner will be able to locate European countries on a map of Europe through the act of playing My European Vacation.

Object To get your passport stamped for all those countries that have been chosen at the beginning of the game.

Contents:

game board
container for dice and cards
playing tokens, each a different color
18 draw cards with instructions to move ahead or back
12 move cards, numbered one, two or three
3 dice imprinted with the names of the 18 countries
1 rolling dice used to determine movement around the perimeter of the board
folding magnetized passports with magnetized pieces containing the names of the countries and simulated passport stamps.

60704.name: My Immune System
60704.description:
Educational game to teach children with immune system disorders about the parts of their immune system, and the treatments to expect from the doctor. This will help them understand their disease and feel more comfortable being around doctors, taking intravenous drugs and antibiotics.

Object of the game is to be the first person to reach 100 points and a board free of infections wins.

60705.name: Math Mall
60705.description:
Educational math-game

Object of the Game:
The first player to make a purchase from each of the 12 stores and exit the mall wins. If time runs out the player with the most purchases wins.

Contents:
* Math Mall game board
* 4 game pieces (erasers)
* 50 Question Cards for each store (600 total) .
* 1 calculator
* 100 Mall Coupons, 50 Food Court Cards, 50 ATM cards
* 100 Balance sheets
* 100 sheets of paper and 4 pencils
* Game Money
* Three 6-sided dice
* 1 egg timer (Approx. 90 seconds)
* 2 Card Holders (Spiral)

60706.name: Mountain Pursuit
60706.description:
This game will allow learners to apply basic mountaineering, first aid, and historical knowledge in a safe, educational setting. The learners will be allowed to make typical real-life choices that will affect the outcome of their progress through the game. The learners will realize that the difference between safe hiking, and even life and death stems from the decisions that are made while hiking on a mountain. Many of the decisions a hiker needs to make are very simple but can yield drastic results given certain circumstances.

The object of the game is simple: be the first to hike up to the summit of Mount Washington and come back down.

Contents:
* Game Board
* 4 Game Pieces
* Six sided die
* 1 stack of Event Cards

boardgamecompilation.35863: The 15 Greatest Board Games in the World

60707.description: Conspirateurs is a traditional board game from France. It was probably invented sometime before 1800, but after the French Revolution (1789) as it seems to be inspired by the rivalling factions of that time. The game resembles Halma and Chinese Checkers - players hop over friendly or enemy pieces to get to their destinations. The players attempt to bring their 20 marbles into the 39 shelter holes.
60707.name: Conspirateurs

60708.name: Pallanguli
60708.description:
The board has 14 cups and each player is controlling seven. Six seeds are placed in each cup. The game is over when a player is unable
to fill any cups with six seeds at the end of a round.

60709.name: Gabata
60709.description:
Gabata (also spelled "Gebeta") is the generic term for mancala games played in Ethiopia and Eritrea. It is used for many two-row games, but also for several three-rank mancala games.

A wide-spread three-rank gabata is Abalala'e (Tigrinya for "eating"), which is played in the highlands of Eritrea. A quote from the Mancala World Wiki (http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Abalala%27e):

"[The game] was first described as Abalalà by Harold Courlander in 1943. The ethiopist Richard Pankhurst learned the same game in 1971 from Abba Pawlos Tzadua of Serae, Abba Zacharias of Akala Guzay, Michael Yacob of Akala Guzay and Gabra Sellasé Gabra Amlak of Serae. All these players were Christians who either served at the Catholic Cathedral of Addis Abbaba or were students at the Haile Seilassie I University. (...) [It] is played by males and females, usually in holes in the ground, particularly in the period of marriages largely after the harvest season from November to January."

Rules of play and demeanor can be found on the aforementioned site.

60710.description: Ravensburger children's game. It is memory based game in which one card with animal is put into hole in game box and players try to find match with second card they pull from stock.
60710.name: Der Maulwurf und sein Versteck-Spiel

60712.name: Twas the Night Before Deathmas
60712.description:
From the book:

A single scene holiday themed mission for agents.

Grandfather Frost, Father Christmas, Saint Nicholas, Kris Kringle, Santa Claus: legends all, or more accurately myth. Everyone knows Santa isn’t real everyone that is, but the children, in whose dreams he makes the rounds each year, bringing happiness and presents to all the nice boys and girls. They leave out cookies and milk, sherry and mince pies, and carrots for his reindeer, in hopes that he’ll remember their good deeds, and sometimes forget the bad. They write letters and wish lists, and visit him in shopping malls everywhere. Their parents indulge them, letting them dream as long as they can, because that’s the magic of childhood: dreams without limit, faith without question. At some point, though, everyone grows up and leaves Santa behind. They abandon their fancy and Christmas
becomes merely special, rather than magical. Little do they know that’s just as Santa prefers.

This Christmas, one lucky group of agents learns the truth and has the chance to save Christmas for everyone. Maybe, just maybe, they’ll also remember what it’s like to dream.

60713.name: Ordo Draconis (Issue 1 - Autumn 2009)
60713.description:
Table of Contents:

"From the Horse's Mouth": Dave Morris and James Wallis answer your Dragon Warriors questions! (p.5)
"Rules of the House": House rules for your Dragon Warriors campaign (p.11)
"The Friar Profession": A wandering man of the cloth from writer Edmund Wilfong (p.15)
"Along the Road": Four easy-to-use encounters from Damian May (p. 21)
"The Thuland Campaign - Introduction": The first in an ongoing series by Cameron Smith (p.25)
"The County of Anglicia": Roger Calver details a county in Ellesland (p.27)
"Believing in Faerie": Dave Morris muses about the role of faerie in the Lands of Legend (p.30)
"The Ruins of Castle Cerreg": An adventure in southern Darbon (p.32)
"Dragon Warriors Character Sheet": Created by Anthony Holtberg (p.37)

60714.name: Fragile Minds
60714.description:
From the book:

Bring a climate of fear to your table with Fragile Minds, the complete cosmic horror toolkit for Spycraft 2.0! This huge product expands the innovative stress system to incorporate insanity, forbidden tomes, shock and dread, and Things That Should Not Be!

Fragile Minds does not rely on other Crafty Games products, and is easily applied to any Spycraft game, from a military campaign featuring the true horrors of war to a full-blown Lovecraftian romp.

This landmark Spycraft expansion includes:

* Horror! Test the player characters’ mettle with new events and campaign qualities. Introduce realistic or supernatural horror to your seasons! Make magic a truly dark art with rules for forbidden knowledge and stress-inducing magic!
* Madness! Push characters to the breaking point and beyond with new and enhanced rules for stress damage, including mental injuries on the loathsome Table of Sproing! Go crazy with rules for insanity and mental conditions: creeping paranoia, violent hallucinations, catatonia, schizophrenia, and more. It’s all here!
* Lore! Learn deadly secrets and spells with an all-new set of rules for Forbidden Knowledge and the dastardly tomes that contain it. Take your game to the next level with story-driven mechanics that plant you firmly behind the wheel! Too bad you’re pointed at a cliff.
* Monsters! Challenge your team with a liberal sampling of creatures designed for cosmic horror and cinematic play. Fray the edges of your PC’s sanity with serial killers, chainsaw maniacs, mutants, and creatures inspired by the celebrated Cthulhu Mythos!

60716.description: Each player has a cherry tree and places a number of cherries (red chips) on the fields of the tree. Some worms have to be covered, too. The active player now takes cherries from other players' trees and places them on his or her tree until he or she uncovers a worm. Then it's the next player's turn. The first player to have filled his or her entire tree with cherries is the winner.
60716.name: Nachbar's Kirschen

60717.description: Roll and move game for kids. Pawns are moved according to the dice results; on certain fields, jam glasses are collected. There is also a bear which can be moved instead of the pawns; when the bear reaches the finish line, the player with most jam glasses is the winner.
60717.name: Paddington Bär

60721.name: Dungeon (Issue 171 - Oct 2009)
60721.description:
Features:

Chaos Scar: Stick in the Mud By Aeryn “Blackdirge” Rudel: A group of bullywugs have claimed the muddy ruins of an ancient keep as their own. Can the PCs root them out and find out what lurks at the heart of their lair? A Chaos Scar adventure for 1st-level PCs.

Treed! By Tim Eagon: An owlbear has been tormenting a tribe of elves and trapped a gnome from the Feywild. The PCs have the opportunity to find passage to the Feywild and earn the elves trust if they act quickly. A Side Trek for 7th-level PCs.

Grasp of the Mantled Citadel By Creighton Broadhurst: The Scales of War Adventure Path continues. The characters continue their quest to find a wellhidden ally of Tiamat, in a pocket domain hidden within Monadhan, the domain of betrayal. As the PCs enter the lair of a foul and corrupt enemy, they learn the full scale of Tiamat’s agenda, and defeat a pair of powerful foes before the full horror of her plans can be revealed. A Scales of War adventure for 22nd-level PCs.

Chaos Scar: Den of the Slave-Takers By Rob Heinsoo: An gnoll outcast has taken up residence in the valley of the Chaos Scar, hoping to do a brisk business in the slave trade. But his allies have different plans for the captured slaves. A Chaos Scar adventure for 1st-level PCs.

Columns:

Editorial by Chris Youngs: Playing in the Deep End

Deities & Demigods: Raven Queen By Robert J. Schwalb: Learn about the groups who pursue the Raven Queen’s agendas across the world and beyond.

Campaign Workshop: Hero Battle: Drizzt By Chris Sims & Chris Youngs: Face off against the legendary dark elf hero in this ready-to-play encounter, with several hooks for possible expansion into a full-scale adventure.

Ruling Skill Challenges By Mike Mearls: Mike continues to educate on the nature of skill challenges, with unique applications and examples.

Save My Game By Stephen Radney-MacFarland: A DM’s best friend? Stephen Radney-MacFarland, back with more advice and letters from the mailbag.

Dungeoncraft By James Wyatt, Andy Collins & Christopher Perkins: James discusses the latest changes to his fledgling campaign. This month: Guest columnists!

60722.name: RockFest
60722.description:
A light perfect-information card game.

Each player has 6 identical double sided cards representing bands, with various abilities; there is also a stack of Fan tokens with a "merchandise value" available for those bands to attract. Each turn you must either play a Band card with the "Opening Act" side up, or flip a band from the Opening Act side to the "Headliner" side. In addition to the points scored from the abilities during the game, each player will score points equal to the merch value of the Fans their Bands have attracted.

2 players can play with one copy, and additional copies can be added so that more players can play.

60723.name: Dragon (Issue 67 - Nov 1982)
60723.description:
Vol. VII No. 5 of Dragon Magazine. (This issue was misprinted as "Vol. VII No. 6")

Cover Art by Jack Crane.

This issue included FEDIFENSOR - A scenario for AD&D adventuring on the Astral Plane as well as THE ASTRAL PLANE: A special section.

60724.name: Pocket Knight Chess
60724.description:
The board is set-up as for a normal game of chess. The moves and sequence of play are not changed.

Before the start of play, however, each player takes an extra knight which is placed "in a pocket". Once during the game, the player may put this extra knight on any free square on the board. The knight may be placed to give check or checkmate. The only restriction is that the space must be empty. Placing the pocket knight is instead of making a normal move. After this, the additional knight moves as usual.

NB: It is recommended that the knight be put in a pocket, or at some distance from the board, so that it is not confused with pieces which have been captured during the game.

Pocket Knight Chess can also be played with no additional pieces, just two knights per player. In this version, each player removes a knight from the opening set-up prior to starting play. This knight becomes the "pocket knight". The "same" knights should be taken by each player (i.e. both remove their Queen's Knight).

60725.name: Different Worlds (Issue 41 - Jan 1986)
60725.description:
User comment:

The cover story was actually unlisted in the table of contents. Added for completeness.

Contents

The Druids: The Oldest Secret Society by E.S. Erkes
The Adventures of Doc Savage by Michael Szymanski
Dreamworld by Keith Herber
Losing Your Marbles in Call of Cthulhu by Thomas M. Holsinger
(Interview with Frank Frazetta by C.J. Henderson)

Module
Opertation: Deep Freeze by Robert Rosethal

Regular Features
Different Views
Editorial
Sword of Hollywood
Conventions
Film Review
Game Reviews
New Games
Film Reviews
A Letter from Gigi

60726.name: Dwarven Halls
60726.description:
From the back of the book:

Dwarven Halls is a full campaign setting for the Swordbearer adventure gaming system, according to the back of the book. More than just an adventure pack, it presents an entire culture and maps a region for adventuring. Says it is probably the most in-depth study of Dwarven society ever presented and is a real must for any serious fantasy role-player.
FGU 7511

60727.name: Marsh of the Wild Things
60727.description:
Publisher Blurb:

So- people say you’re pretty good in a fight. "Hero" might be putting too fine of a point on things, but adventure certainly seems to find you even when you’re not actively seeking it out yourself. You’ve solved mysteries, foiled plots, and fought evil with steel and spell. You’ve seen all manner of creatures and traveled from the most impressive cities to the most simple villages. A place like Flintpoint here hardly even qualifies as a village- it’s more like a waystation on the road around the marsh. But don’t write us off just yet. Someone needs to know about the things we’ve been hearing in the marsh. Dangerous things. Menacing things. Wild things.

Marsh of the Wild Things, an adventure for 8th level characters, is easily dropped into practically any fantasy campaign setting. Much of this adventure takes place outdoors, making it especially suited for adventuring parties with a Druid, Ranger, or other characters with the Track feat. Taking inspiration from classic fantasy adventures, Wild Things challenges heroes with unexpected foes, a strange ally, and lots of heart-thumping combat.
The details:


44 pages of content
2 GM maps,
1 player handout
Includes suggestions for adjusting the difficulty for higher or lower level heroes.
Includes both a full version and a printer-friendly version


Are your heroes ready to face Wild Things? Find out today!

60728.name: Different Worlds (Issue 42 - May 1986)
60728.description:
Contents

The Art of James Warhola by C.J. Henderson
Empire of the Incas by Michael Szymanski
Dragon Manor by Robert E. Howard and C.J. Henderson
Archaelogical Expeditions by Thomas M. Holsinger
Facts of Life in the Middle Ages by Paul Montgomery Crabaugh

Module
Garbage Pits of Despair, Part 1 by Dave Arneson

Regular Features
Poll Results
Editorial
Sword of Holywood
Cons
Poll
Game Reviews
New Games
Film Reviews
A Letter from Gigi

60729.name: Horror20
60729.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Get ready to take your horror campaign to the 20th power! Horror20 provides all you need to spice up your modern campaign with terror. This 89 page codex includes new skills, feats, equipment, and a player's guide to ghost-hunting. Game Masters aren't left out, either. With Fear and Sanity mechanics, help with creating "hauntings" for your players, and sample creatures including ghosts and undead, there's plenty for the GM to sink his teeth into.

From the introduction:
Welcome to Horror20, the terror-ific supplement to use with RPGObjects’ Modern20 system for modern mayhem and mystery! 12 to Midnight has accepted RPGObjects’ invitation to build a foundation for horror gaming which is presented in the pages that follow.

The authors, as you may guess, enjoy a good ghost story. With this guide you can enter the world of horror and introduce your heroes to spooks and terrors that they must defeat at the risk of losing their sanity. Can they persevere against an ancient long-forgotten evil or must they suffer defeat and become a quick snack to the hideous creatures and spirits of the darkest night? Read on to see the newest take on horror as presented within the Modern20 system.

60730.name: Curses!
60730.description:
User Summary: Includes overview of curse across cultures, as well as new curse-based spells, classes, and feats.

From the introduction:

The purpose of this book is to serve as a supplement to d20 games. It provides new options and material for incorporating a greater use of curses into a d20 fantasy game. This book explains some of the background of the phenomenon of curses as well as a series of new spells, feats and prestige classes. Though primarily intended for the dungeon master (DM), this book can also be used by players.

Curses are magic spells placed upon people, locations or objects with the intent of causing harm. Curses have a long history that spans most cultures and time periods. The common thread in almost all is an intense desire to cause truly pernicious harm to an enemy. Enemies take many forms and occur on many levels; thus, the level of harm and intensity of the curse also vary quite considerably.

60731.name: NPCyclopedia: Psionics
60731.description:
From the introduction:

So you have purchased the Psionics Handbooks, and one of your players has decided to use a psionic class. You want psionics to be part of your world. The problem is that you use a lot of pre-made modules, and those don’t include a lot of psionic characters. Or maybe you’ve procrastinated finishing tonight’s adventure. You’ve got the caverns mapped out, and the traps set, you just don’t have the statistics of the main villain. Or maybe you are looking for a few new ideas to spark you imagination. You might want a reoccurring villain to challenge your characters over the course of the campaign, or you might just need a one short conflict for next week game.
