Whatever your needs, if you use psionics and you use NPCs, this book is for you. NPCyclopedia: Psionics features eleven different psionic NPCs. Each contains a detailed background, adventure hooks, combat tactics, and statistics for every level from 1 to 20. A complex interconnected background between all characters allows you to use these as both one shot NPCs at any level of your choice instantly, or even as interconnected NPCs spanning a longer campaign.

60732.name: Thrash 1.8
60732.description:
"Violent fighting to begin again!"

From the book's opening:

"Thrash is a book-and-dice RPG that deals with anime and fighting game style martial arts. This main rulebook presents only general rules, info on real-world martial arts, and some general fighting game info, though additional sourcebooks will deal with an assortment of popular fighting game worlds.

The Thrash system is heavily based on the now out-of-print Street Fighter Storytelling Game from White Wolf, as well as Mekton Z, and, to a lesser extent, Ninjas and Superspies. The martial arts and the whole system are designed to simulate both fighting games and anime and manga based on them, the result being a highly cinematic game with lots of nifty special moves, energy blasts galore, and so forth."

60733.name: Different Worlds (Issue 43 - Jul 1986)
60733.description:
Contents

The Art of Dave Mattingly by C.J. Henderson
The Adventures of Solar Pons by Michael Syzmanski
RandomQuest by Pam Carlson and Rodney Sauer
The Tongs of America by Michael Syzmanski
Down Among the Dead Men by Oliver Dickenson (sic)
Religion and Race in Role-Playing by Tom Grant
An Occult Who's Who in the 1920's by Richard Kaczynski

Module
Garbage Pits of Despair: Part 2 by Dave Arneson

Regular Features
DW Poll Results
Editorial
Sword of Hollywood
Conventions
DW Poll
Game Reviews
Different Views
New Games In Print
Film Reviews
A Letter from Gigi

60734.name: Thrash 2.0
60734.description:
From the book:
"Everyone rumored
Nobody believed
But you see IT’S TRUE
Now it’s time to have the REAL answer...
Who is....
THE STRONGEST?!"

Thrash 2.0 represents a major overhaul to the Thrash RPG system, staying similar while taking out some of the more broken rules. From the introduction:

"The goal of Thrash was and still is to create a tabletop RPG that captures some of the awesome inherent in 2D fighting games. In retrospect, the original version of Thrash was sloppily put together from bits and pieces of Street Fighter: The Storytelling Game (at the time, White Wolf’s one attempt at a non-WoD game), Mekton Z (still my favorite mecha RPG), and Ninjas & Superspies (Erick Wujcik is awesome!). I think it got more revisions through complaints on the mailing list started by Rob Pool (which is still the official Thrash ML today) than through playtesting. Still, it let you stat up most any fighting game character, and it drew interest from people all over the world."

60735.name: Schuldig!
60735.description:
User Summary:

The Heroes are found guilty for a murder they didn't commit, and are send to prison.

How do they manage to break out and find the person which is responsible for the murder.

A universal fantasy-adventure with stats for AD&D, DSA, Midgard and Ruf des Warlock.

60737.name: The War-Torn Kingdom
60737.description:
From the back of the book:
In THE WAR-TORN KINGDOM, revolution rages in Sokara. You can join forces with the king to restore his throne -- or look for profit in the pay of the dictator, Grieve Marlock. Use fighting skills or sorcery, bribery or skulduggery to survive the assassins in the city backstreets. Descend to the sewers of Yellowport to defeat the vile rat-king, Skabb. Retrieve the golden net of the gods from the Repulsive Ones deep beneath the sea -- and use the rewards of your victories to travel beyond the boundaries of the known world.

The Fabled Lands series is being re-released starting in December 2010. The authors have indicated that if these sell well, they will be able to complete the entire twelve-book series.

60738.name: Cities of Gold and Glory
60738.description:
From the back of the book:
In CITIES OF GOLD AND GLORY you can sail the high seas to Golnir's distant ports. As a warrior, plunder ancient treasures and do battle with the legions of darkness in the hall of the death-god Nagil. As a spy, penetrate the labyrinth of lies and sinister secrets of the scheming merchants of Metriciens. As a sorcerer, barter in mysteries, spells and ancient lore with the immortal wizard Estragon. Amass welath, honours and power that will take you on voyages. to uncharted regions.

60739.name: Over the Blood-Dark Sea
60739.description:
From the back of the book:
OVER THE BLOOD-DARK SEA lie countless islands steeped in mystery. Every port brings peril -- from the half-wild settlements on the edge of Ankon-Konu, to the forbidden cloisters of the sorcerers' colleges of Dweomer. Every voyage means danger -- from murderous pirates and haunted ships.

You can choose to be a daring explorer, in search of conquests, treasures and power. Or a magical savant, invoking the secrets of the occult to annihilate your foes. Or you can amass a fortune as a merchant, trading in spice shipments from the Sea of Hydras to the Innis Shoals.

Decide for yourself how to tackle the perils of the Sea, and reap the rewards that will lead you to greater adventures -- in the fantastic role-playing world of the FABLED LANDS.

60740.name: Mr. Magnet's Scrambled Sentences
60740.description:
The players form sentences on the board using magnetic tiles representing various parts of speech. The object is to use the word tiles to construct a sentence. This game seeks to encourage learners to use adjectives and adverbs in their descriptive writing while reinforcing skills related to proper sentence structure.

The object of the game is to use the word magnets to construct a sentence. Each player competes by creating their own sentences while manipulating and extending the sentences of other players in order to be the first player to use all their word magnets.

Contents:
* Magnetic game board
* 1 detachable base to create turntable
* 4 individual magnetic word boards
* 100 Mr. Magnet cards
* 1 dice
* 50 red nouns magnets
* 30 green verbs
* 20 orange articles
* 15 yellow prepositions
* 20 purple adjectives
* 20 blue adverbs
* 15 pink inflectional endings
* 10 blank white magnets
* 1 grab bag
* 1 two-minute timer

60741.name: Mush! The Iditarod Board Game
60741.description:
Playing this game is a fun and interesting way for students to practice map-reading skills. It is also a great game to include during a social studies unit about Alaska. Educators should teach students how to read a map legend and find directions on a map before introducing this game.

Object of the game is to be the first "musher" to cross the finish line at the end of the Iditarod, a race that captures the spirit of Alaska!

First you will carefully select the Supplies that you will need as you navigate your way across the rough and cold terrain. You'll advance across the board by first correctly answering a Map Card and then by spinning the Distance Wheel. You'll need your Supply Cards to help you face the various Situations that the trail will throw your way.

Contents:
* Game Board
* Distance Wheel
* 4 Sleds (player markers)
* Supply Cards
* Situation Cards
* Chance Cards
* Map Cards

60742.name: Cyberplunder
60742.description:
(user summary)
This scenario pits the heroes, our stuffed animals, inside a Lähmboy (read Gameboy), where they have to brave the dangers of computer adventures and jump-and-run-games alike to finally meet the boss.

60743.name: 51 Pegasi
60743.description:
From the rules:

"Every player is in command of one colony on the planet 51 Pegasi. The colony is defending an extraction mine for the Coke7100, a strategical energy source for all the civilization of the galaxy. The goal of the game is collecting the most quantity of energy resources, defending themselves from the enemy attacks, using energy shield and releasing the power of lasers from our fighter fleet, to destroy the resources of the other players."

Every kit (one is needed for each player) contains:
1 board card,
9 combat cards,
19 action cards,
7 phase cards,
1 resource level cube,
1 victory points cube.

60744.name: Spycraft Declassified: Shadow Play
60744.description:
From the back of the book:

Espionage is constantly evolving. Agents and their handlers are always looking for new ways to outwit the opposition, to beat the odds. Techniques and training, weapons and gadgets every edge helps when the fate of the world hangs in the balance. Now, declassified and available for the first time in print, the latest and greatest tricks of the trade are yours to command.

Spycraft Declassified: Shadow Play collects some of the very best in Crafty Games PDFs and Signs & Portents articles, including Agent X classes and feats, cutting-edge weapons and gear from Bag Full of Guns, advanced combat options and tricks from Practice Makes Perfect, alternate gear systems from The Big Score, flexible Attribute-based classes from Back to Basics, and more! Whether you're a player or a Game Control, this is your chance to upgrade your clearance and raise your game to a whole new level.

60745.name: The Lutrins
60745.description:
Publisher blurb:

Long ago, a great empire existed in harmony with its neighbors through commerce and rule of law. Citizens followed the edicts of their god, who ordered every aspect of their lives. After centuries of peace, a great cataclysm occurred and the god was lost to his people. Without the direction of its god, the empire crumbled and society fell into chaos. A thousand years later, the people live aimless lives and wonder when their final doom will befall them. Can they overcome their melancholy and chaotic ways, or will they and give in to their misery and pass into the twilight?

Races of Twilight: The Lutrins is the second in a series of d20 race supplements from Silven Publishing utilizing the 3.5 rules set. Not simply a collection of elf and dwarf variants, the Races of Twilight series provides detailed information on unique and original player races that can be incorporated into any fantasy campaign. While intended for the experienced gamer who enjoys deep characterization and role-playing over one-dimensional heroics and "roll-playing"? Races of Twilight can be used by anyone who likes unusual characters.

Each of the races presented are in some way approaching the final phase of their cultural, political, or physiological development and are slowly fading from the world. Some have fallen into decadence and apathy; others have lost their dominance and position in a world of multiracial empires; still others have been crushed by disease, overpopulation, or magical travails. Whether each races dies and is forgotten or overcomes its difficulties and thrives is in the hands of players and DMs.

While each book provides numerous details on a new race, plenty of room is left for DMs to develop a unique background and role for that race in his or her campaign world.

Races of Twilight: The Lutrins presents a race of marine-loving humanoids that struggle to find meaning after the loss of their god. Once a powerful and noble race, their society has collapsed and their faith was shattered.


Detailed information on lutrin characters, lands, and culture
A new core class, the Entropist
The entropic philosophy, a replacement for the lutrin religious beliefs of yore
Ten new feats
Three new prestige classes: Lutrin Redeemer, Madcap, and Seadog
New weapons and equipment, both magical and mundane

60746.name: The Sarkuvans
60746.description:
Publisher Description:

Centuries ago, the Morphic Society created a race of shapeshifting enforcers and assassins to carry out their will. They were a scourge on the lands of free people, committing unspeakable acts in the name of their wizard masters. After many decades the Morphic Society was defeated and most of its minions destroyed. Today, the remaining shapeshifters live in the caves and sewers beneath the great cities, plotting death and destruction for their enemies and the seeking the secrets of creating more of their kind. Will they succeed and create a newer, stronger Morphic Society, or will they be cast down to lurk forever in the twilight?

Races of Twilight: Sarkuvans is the third in a series of d20 racial toolkits. Not simply a collection of elf and dwarf variants, the Races of Twilight series provides detailed information on unique and original player races that can be incorporated into any fantasy campaign. While intended for the experienced gamer who enjoys deep characterization and role-playing over one-dimensional heroics and "roll-playing," Races of Twilight can be used by anyone who likes unusual characters.

Each of the races presented are in some way approaching the final phase of their cultural, political, or physiological development and are slowly fading from the world. Some have fallen into decadence and apathy; others have lost their dominance and position in a world of multiracial empires; still others have been crushed by disease, overpopulation, or magical travails. Whether each races dies and is forgotten or overcomes its difficulties and thrives is in the hands of players and DMs.

While each book provides numerous details on a new race, plenty of room is left for DMs to develop a unique background and role for that race in his campaign world.

Races of Twilight: The Sarkuvans features the following:


Detailed information on sarkuvan characters, lands, and culture
Three evil gods and demon lords
A detailed look at crafting poisons
New character feats, many that are unique to the sarkuvan race
Three new prestige classes: the Living Weapon, the Mimic, and the Morphic Mage
Two new clerical domains and seven new spells
New weapons and equipment, both magical and mundane

60748.name: Koriän's Magical Compendium: Runestones
60748.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Runestones - magically imbued, rune carved stones that will take your characters to new levels of power!

Now, at long last, Koriän's Magical Compendium will open the door on the lost lore of Runestone crafting and use. Inside its pages you will discover wonders of arcane power that awaits only your eagerness to harness and use them.

Runestones features:


Rules for using runestones
Statistics for 27 runestones
2 new spells
1 new prestige class
1 new item material
2 new monsters

60749.name: Ramana
60749.description: The game board looks similar to a Carrom board, but the goal is not to sink disks into holes, but to flick rings against other rings and into certain areas in the center of the board where each ring counts a number of points. After the first ring is flicked, each further ring has to touch another ring to be able to score. There are also some obstacles on the board (around the center).

60750.name: Mitarra - The Agenda of Itherelle
60750.description:
User Note: Available as a pdf with several audio enhanced features.

Publisher Blurb:

The party is sent on a quest to the Cave of Crystals to gather rare spell components. Experience the thrill of the search as they venture into the wild, meet a tribe of barbarian elves, and battle their way though forests and caverns to the final confrontation, in search of their goal!

The Caves of Crystal is the second in a long series of adventures comprising the Agenda of Itherelle. Designed to bring a party of 4-6 2nd level characters together and introduce their players to Mitarra, The Caves of Crystal is more than just an adventure. It is also a resource for the Mitarra nation, with everything DMs need to get familiar with the nation, but not so much to be overwhelming.

Mitarra is a small, geographically isolated, human civilization that can be placed into most larger, pre-existing settings with little effort.

Within the pages are an extensive look at Mitarra the city, and its newest town, Istanus. Included are maps, a presentation of the leaders, and a thumbnail tour of each of the cities’ various districts. The module includes extensive game notes and DM aids, full color and black and white maps, and a series of complete PDF bookmarks for easy reference.

60751.name: Rechenlotto
60751.description: Each player has a board with a number of calculations. A number tile is held up. The first player to find a calculation with that result gets the number tile and covers the calculation. The first player to completely cover his or her board is the winner.

60752.name: Ringlein an der Hand
60752.description: 20 rings are placed on the game board, "face down" (so the ornament on top cannot be seen). Each player has a little board with a combination of five ornaments. An arrow is spun and points to a color. The active player now takes one of the rings on a square of that color and checks the ornament - if it is one on his/her board, he/she puts it on his/her finger. The first player to have one required ring on each finger is the winner.

60753.description:
From 1941 through the spring of 1944 the Red Army bore the principal burden of opposing the German Wehrmacht on the continent of Europe. The armored and mobile forces would eventually be forged into a weapon capable of smashing the German armed forces, but it was the infantry and artillery which held the Germans at bay in the critical fighting of 1941 and 1942, and kept the Soviet Union in the war.

Regardless of what rule system you play with, this supplement is the indispensable and definitive guide to the Soviet infantry and artillery in World War II. It includes organizational and order of battle information not available in any other single volume.


TO&E charts for all Soviet infantry and artillery divisions, and separate brigades and regiments in World War II, including organizational and equipment changes. Among the less common, but important, units covered are: NKVD Border Guards and Internal Security troops Airborne Rifle brigades and corps Ski brigades and battalions, along with attached aerosan units. Naval infantry brigades.



Revised and expanded Soviet data charts.



Aircraft ratings for all Soviet combat aircraft in the west.



Appendices cover the strength and organization of the Soviet-organized forces of Czechoslovakia and Poland.
60753.name: Red Tide

60754.description:
It's springtime again and the penguins start marching. Every penguin has their own number of floes they wish to cross. Lead them the way and score an iceberg.

Contents
17 Penguin cards (with 1-3 ice floes)
35 Floe cards (with 1-4 ice floes)
The rules

Gameplay
The players all have 5 cards, 2 cards with a penguin on some floes and 3 with only floes. You start with 1 floe card in the middle of the table.
On your turn you may play a penguin card if the number of floes on the penguin card and the floes of the cards in the middle exactly matches the number on your penguin card. Since the floe cards in the middle are on a row you can access them from either the left or the right. How many floe cards are needed to add up to the number on your penguin card is free. As long as it matches exactly. If possible you can also play your second penguin card.
Then you always play a floe card on either side of the line. So even if you can't play any penguin card you still add floes to the line to hopefully collect in your next turn (if they aren't scooped up by the other players).
The last thing you do is fill up your hand so that you again have 2 penguin cards and 3 floe cards.

The game continues until either the penguins are all played or until it's no longer possible to play the remaining penguins.
At that point all the numbers on the penguin cards are added up. The player with the highest number of floes wins.
60754.name: Ice Hop

60755.name: The Pun is Mightier than the Sword
60755.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Picture this.

You want to inject some humor into your games, but you want to do it with some style. Spells, feats and items your gaming group can grin about while actually using them in their adventure. The Pun is Mightier than the Sword is the book you have been waiting for!

Where else can you find out how to strip an adversary bare with a Full Monty spell or see how yelling "God Damn It!" actually gets a reaction from a god? Where Kentucky Fried comes with the sides for free and Mojo actually makes you cooler? It’s not the Size That Matters, you can Throw Your Weight Around, and, of course, Where There’s a Will There’s a Way.

This book is for all those DMs that want to introduce players to a wealth of jargon taken from our day-to-day language that has been given a whole new meaning in the realms of d20. Equip your players with a Cupid’s Arrows or incapacitate a hapless victim with a Peel of ROFLMAO

The Pun is Mightier than the Sword features:


Over 25 new items as well as weapons
4 prestige classes with sample characters
Over 30 spells
Over 25 feats

60756.name: Auspicious Beginnings
60756.description:
User Note: Free pdf adventure.

Subtitle: An introductory adventure for Weapons of the Gods

From the introduction:

Welcome! Auspicious Beginnings is a tutorial adventure for Weapons of the Gods, designed to teach the game to new players over a single 3-4 hour session of play. We’ve included pre-generated characters, handouts, an adventure Loresheet and a fast-paced adventure following the player characters through the exotic Six Devils City: everything you need for a one-shot, demo, or a pre-campaign warm up!

Auspicious Beginnings is also suitable for campaign play for Rank 4 characters. You can expect players who know the Weapons of the Gods system to chew through the material presented here very quickly though, so be ready to follow and embellish any hooks that interest the players.

In order to fit within a single-session timeframe, the events of Auspicious Beginnings are fairly linear, with a fixed series of encounters. However, the adventure introduces the concept of Loresheets in such a way as to give the players a great deal of control over the context and aesthetics of play, as well as the destiny of the PCs and NPCs alike!

60759.name: Oakling
60759.description:
From the publisher:

Nature is not good, nor is it evil. Its children could as easily save a forest, as burn one down. Living embodiments of nature have often been portrayed as either avid protectors or reclusive and dangerous hermits. This has been especially true of sentient plant species. However, most of all, nature is unpredictable. Perhaps it was in this spirit the oaklings were born. When the first oaklings marched inexplicably from the forest, the tree huggers cheered a new ally. After all, oaklings have all the hallmarks of a friend of the wood; being basically medium sized living trees with green leafy faces. However, the oaklings cared little for conservation. In fact, it was quite the opposite. Oaklings are an industrious species that has little regard for sentiment or emotion. Coldly logical, the oaklings took up branch to their own cause; the betterment of themselves. Like nature, they are not inherently good or evil; they could as easily take up sides with a goodly king as they could a deplorable dictator. So catch some sun, grow some roots, and spread your leaves. This powerful new PC race can come crashing into your game!

60760.name: The Plains of Howling Darkness
60760.description:
From the back of the book:
Explore THE PLAINS OF HOWLING DARKNESS, where barbaric nomads attack all who enter their dealdly wilderness. Where legendary prizes await the adventurer who can release the High King from his frozen tomb. Where a city of ghosts guards the Shadar's treasure vaults. Where the secret of immortality is contained in the ancient evil of Kaschuf the Deathless...

Fantastic quests and hideous dangers await travellers in this savage land. You can choose to be a warrior, using weapons and combat skills to defeat opponents. Or a mystical mage, skilled in sorcery. Or a clever rogue, acquiring wealth and powerful amulets by theft and trickery.

60762.name: The Court of Hidden Faces
60762.description:
From the back of the book:
At THE COURT OF HIDDEN FACES, no one is who they seem. The sinister lords of the Uttakin go masked to hide their treachery. The secret police of the god Ebron kill those who flout their fanatical codes. In this tyrannical realm of betrayal and assassination, life is cheap. But rich rewards await the daring adventurer.

Will you uncover the secrets of the High King's citadel, where no man has trod for ten generations? Or wrest the holy sword from the crypt of Kizil Irmak, the War Prophet? Or find the key that will allow you to travel back in time..?

60763.name: Lords of the Rising Sun
60763.description:
From the back of the book
The LORDS OF THE RISING SUN rule the exotic kingdom of Akatsurai. But great warrior clans constantly seek to overthrow them. In the turmoil of war, there are countless opportunities for a quick-witted adventurer. Will you spy for the Shogun? Or become one of the Sovereign's knights in your pursuit of riches and power?

Track down the elusive, raven-winged Tengu to learn the secret arts of sorcery and swordplay... Defeat vampires, skilled in martial arts, who guard the Lost Tomb of the Necromancer... Enter the dreadful cloisters of the Noboro Monastery, where you will fight the most dangerous opponent of all -- yourself...

60766.name: Playbär: Am Rande der Unendlichkeit
60766.description:
User summary:
This is not so much a roleplaying book, but a short story with lots of comic art set into the PP&P universe of living stuffed toy animals. It is very humorous in style and draws heavily from different pop topics like Star Trek and Cthulhu. The Playbär background of Comic Artist FeliX is strictly adult, but always tongue-in-cheek.

60767.name: Secret Liason
60767.description:
From the back of the book

Master Ames is leading a trade expedition into the Dreadwood. What a great opportunity to make a few bucks as a guard for hhis expedition. But why hire so many? And why is Master Ames not telling where the expedition is ultimately leading?

Secret Liason is a Fantasy adventure for 4-6 beginning players of The DUEL System, or other popular fantasy role playing games.

Ownership of DUEL is recommended, but is not required.

60768.name: Mega-Duel
60768.description:
From the back of the book

This book contains all the advanced rules for use with The DUEL System, including Sectional Armor, Sweep Attacks, Non-Lethal Attacks, New Magic Spells, a complete Gun List, The DUEL System GameMaster Screens, and much much more! Also included is a section on how to run Role Playing Games - A Must Read For All Game Masters!

60769.name: Mithian's Book of Magic

rpgissuearticle.188905: The Oft Bitter Pill: Capsule Reviews

60769.description:
From the back of the book

A one-of-a-kind spell creation supplement that you can use to create an unlimited number of spells and magic items!

Sorcerers have lost their souls trying to learn its secrets; Kings have waged wars trying to control its powers; Gods hold it in contempt, fearful of the knowledge it possess...

60770.name: Character Sheets & Quick Reference Tables
60770.description:
From the back cover

This supplement includes 18 attractive Soothsayer character record sheets and 40 role-playing assessment sheets.

And the inside cover is crammed with all the facts and tables you need most frequently. With all this information in quick reference format you can really get on with the game.

That makes this supplement an indispensable aid for Soothsayers and players alike!

60771.name: Set in Stone
60771.description:
From the back of the book

Set in Stone is a high fantasy adventure for Soothsayer's Middle Ages technology era.

Can the unlikely group of travelling adventurers rescue a mysterious Lady's husband and simultaneously avert a senseless war? If they hope to succeed they'll have to rub shoulders with some surly locals, rough it in the untamed wilderness, avoid getting walloped by throngs of muscular half-wits and then sneak right under the nose of a notoriously cantankerous sorcerer! But hey, isn't that what adventuring is all about.

Set in Stone includes four pre-generated Soothsayer characters so that you can get right down to business, or can be adapted to suit your very own campaign setting. So dust off the old adventuring boots, it's time to earn your pay!

60772.name: Inside the Zone
60772.description:
From the back of the book

Within the hull of the zone, humanity seems safe and secure. The darchcomen and the unity take good care to cover all traces of daemonic encounter and intrusion.

However, secret societies planand daemons plot schemes so hidedus and devestating that conspiracies and propaganda fail to hide evils taint from the populace.

Often, humanity lies prey to infernal forces and terrors so sinister that the zone pulls out all stops to thwart these revealing menaces.

Whether it is through the advancement of science and technologies, or mystical and military might, nothing will keep humanity from defending its last refuge.
This book is a must for those players wishing to gain the edge over hell and its aphotic minions, or those hoping to sidestep the vigilance of the law.

Obsidian Inside the Zone details:

The four subsectors of the nocturnal banks.
Daily transportation and the sublevel lifts.
The creation and examples of packs of the lost.
The politics and broods of the chemical.
All thirty house of the internal.
The four mysterious sects of the box of under. Silesia's control over the zone.
New technologies, such as cybernetics, upgrades and bionetics. Libraries, arenas, clubs, and casinos.
A thorough look at sector 34, including personalities.
New daemons commonly found within the zone.
The kult of the pestilence zone-strain.
As well as a hoard of new game information.

60773.name: Stormwatch
60773.description:
From the back of the book

Her Majesty's orders are clear, "Go forth and fortify our northern border!"

Your party has been charged with expanding her Majesty's kingdom into the Arivain Plains, to create a buffer between the nation of Elb and the advancing Orc horde. Many trials await your party, but the rewards for success are tremendous.

An adventure for 4-8 characters of 1st to 3rd level. This adventure can be played with either the World of Tannoth campaign setting detailed in the Game Master's Handbook, or in your own campaign setting.

Also included are eight pre-generated, beautifully illustrated character cards with pre-generated characters ready to drop into your own adventures.

60774.name: Character Sheets
60774.description:
From the back of the book

When robot assassins and goblin thugs come knocking at your door, you'll need more than your sword; you'll need your wits about you, a complete inventory of your weapons, and, of course, everything in order. In short, you'll need Wizards character sheets.

After all how can you fight the Nazi mutants when you're rummaging through your backpack looking for the scrap of paper with the secret map? And how will you overcome the vile plots of the malevolent Wizard Blackwolf when you don't even have a good handle on your own personality?

This book gives you two dozen character sheets, each printed front and back, with plenty of room for you to detail your character's traits, skills, contacts, and possessions. The sheets are customized for practitioners of magic and warriors, as well as for those who have wings. In addition, there's a handy space on each sheet for you to list your character's mount, be it a ross or a dragonfly.

Included in this booklet are:

twelve Warrior character sheets, for non-magical elves, dwarves, etc.,
six Magus character sheets for practitioners of magic,
four Flyer character sheets for fairies who prefer spears to spells, and
two Fairy character sheets for those who both fly and use magic.




More room for more detail. Now when those robots and reptilions come a-calling, you'll be ready for them.

60775.name: Montagar
60775.description:
From the back of the book

"For Montagar, Forever!"
-Weehawk

This 80-page source book details the land of Montagar, the magical land which is the home of Avatar, Elinore, and Weehawk. The politics of Montagar, as well as the social, geographic, and economic makeup are. covered. A detailed map is provided, and new backgrounds arid traits unique to Montagar's citizens are explained. This book also provides additional source material on the land, its peoples, and the strange creatures that can be found there. Finally, the book includes a short adventure which highlights the unique facets of this beautiful land.

Montagar is not a stand alone product and requires the Ralph Bakshi's Wizards Basic Game. It is intended to enhance the play of the basic game as well as create an expanded playing environment which builds upon the 1977 animated classic.


A detailed map of Montagar, its towns, villages and cities
Information on red elf tribes and their territories
New creatures and plant life indigenous to Montagar
New races including meadow & swamp fairies, centaurs and satyrs
New skills and background packages
A full length adventure, ready to play

60776.name: Rifts Game Master Guide
60776.description:
Partially from the back of the book:

The Rifts Game Master Guide is the ultimate Rifts reference and sourcebook which includes
- All skills listed and described.
- Combat rules and examples of play.
- The weapons of Rifts Earth, plus data on E-Clips, credits and more.
- Power armor and body armor.
- Vehicles and general equipment.
- Comprehensive index of O.C.C.s, R.C.C.s, P.C.C.s, and Monsters.
- Experience tables for all character classes.
- Designer notes and rules clarifications.
- Game Master tips and hints for running Rifts.
- Maps, adventure ideas, and reference material galore.
- Over 300 pages!

60777.name: To Tackle the T.O.T.E.M.
60777.description:
From the back of the book

Hidden away in the Arizona desert lies the secret base of T.O.T.E.M.*, led by the infamous Purple Mask! Can you defend the Cogan Museam from the attack of his super-powered agents? For unless they are stopped, TOTEM will soon control the world! An incredible adventure for the Villains & Vigilantes game.


Total Order Through Elimination of the Masses -- Editor

60778.name: Chrome #1 / #2
60778.description:
User summary

Chrome #1 / #2 is a compilation of the supplements Chrome Book and Chrome Book 2.


From the back of the book

Shop Til They Drop

In this second compilation of the bestselling Chromebook series, we bring together our hit volumes 1 and 2 for a serious one-two punch!

Including:


Cyberware: New tech and new metal to maximize your character!
Vehicles: Cars, bikes, copters, AVs and - Dragons?
Software: Brain burning superware for cracking the toughest Data fortresses
Weapons: Stopping power and style in dozens of potent packages!
Fashion 2000 Plus: Seductive styles and lethal looks from Eji, Psiberstuff and other hot designers!
Exotics: New bio-bodyware to uncage the animal in you!
Services: When you absolutely, positively have to get it done - by someone else!
Housing: Because there's more to life than a Renta-cube!
Full Body Borgs: New Body Replacements for the Metal-Inclined!
Teams: Manpower for hire! No job too big! No contact too deadly!


Back in print and ready to boost your campaign to the next level; It's Chromebook 1/2

Because in Cyberpunk, you can never be too rich - or too far out on the Edge!

60780.name: Out of the Abyss
60780.description:
From the back of the book

A demon castle stands empty, its final battle unfinished, its master lost. The secrets of the castle beckon those whom would brave the perils of the Kingdom of Pain. Sinister Forces conspire to eradicate even the whispers of what has transpired. Beneath the currents of deceit lies a scheme that threatens the Hierarchy of Hell.

Out of the Abyss is an adventure supplement set in the Kingdom of Pain featuring horrendous battles and vicious subterfuge. This invaluable tome contains insight into the machinations of Satan's realm. It includes plots and characters that will return to haunt your Inferno campaign.


Graphically Illustrated Introduction
Complete Character Profiles and Statistics
Exciting Free-Flowing Plot
Complete adventure supplement for use with the Inferno role-playing game

60781.description:
In the game, each player owns two types of three-dimensional blocks of wood:
angles and rods.

It can be played two different versions:

Reach the middle of the board from the corner sections by touching the stones of a color on the surfaces.

OR

In the second variant to get rid as many pieces as possible, and only touch the stones of one color at the edges.

---
In dem Spiel Winkelzüge hat jeder Spieler zwei Arten von dreidimensionalen Steinen aus Holz: Winkel und Stäbe.

Es können zwei verschieden Varianten gespielt werden:

Entweder von der Mitte des Spielfeldes aus die Eckfelder erreichen, wobei die Steine einer Farbe sich an der Fläche berühren müssen
Oder in der zweiten Variante so viele Steine wie möglich verbauen, wobei sich die Steine einer Farbe nur an den Kanten berühren dürfen.
60781.name: Winkelzüge

60782.name: Adventure II
60782.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to Adventure II, a collection of d20 Fantasy scenarios from Alderac Entertainment Group. These modules were first released at the dawn of the d20 movement under the "Adventure Keep" title, providing Dungeon Masters with ready-to-play adventures: one-shot stories or links to home grown campaigns. For this collection, we retooled all of the game rules to comply with the new 3.5 Edition of the d20 System. In addition, we added dozens of options for running the adventures, expanded advice for the DM, created random encounter charts, helped with PC knowledge and information regarding the adventure, made bardic knowledge more useful, and added (new) improved encounters that are sure to make the adventures stellar. In some cases, the plots themselves are reworked to get the most drama out of your game and to keep internal logic consistent.

60783.name: Race Car Math
60783.description: Race Car Math is a fantastically fun way to learn and practice addition and subtraction. Zip and Zoom your race car around the track, solving addition and subtraction problems. Getting to the finish line first isn't going to be easy! Look out for tricky spots on the game board, like "flat tire" and "engine trouble". Let the race begin!

60784.name: The Nanny Game
60784.description:
The game is designed to be played by prospective nannies. The game is supplemental material to a comprehensive childcare course and should be played more than once.

The object of the game is to collect three different nanny monies during each time track and be the first player to return to the nanny quarters at the end of the day.

Contents:
* Game board: A graphical representation of a clock that supports two to four players
* Pieces: Pieces representing various nannies in film and television
* Question cards (morning, midday, and evening): Questions covering four topics related to periods of childhood
* Discussion cards: Questions that pertain to unpredictable events that elicit player discussion
Reality check cards: Cards that present challenges at various stages in the game
* Die: A single die
* Spinner: A means of choosing questions based on the four topics
* Fake money (bills) as prizes: Morning money, midday money, and evening money each with icons representing each age category

60785.name: Network Security: Protect and Defend
60785.description:
This game is designed for information technology professionals who are new to the network security field.

The object of the game is to build secure financial service businesses and acquire servers and datacenters. The player with the most assets and cash wins.

Contents:
* Game board
* Dice
* Common objects to be used as tokens, for example, coins, buttons, small stones
* Monopoly "Hotels and Houses" to represent "Servers and Datacenters"
* Good News, Bad News
* Title cards
* Play money

60786.name: Neuron Nemesis
60786.description:
The game reinforces the players' knowledge of the human brain. In addition to learning/relearning about the brain's anatomy, physiology, chemistry, functions, disfunctions, and evolution, the players will enjoy the strategy and competition of the game.

Player or team who answers the most questions correctly wins.

60787.name: Odd or Even
60787.description:
Odd/Even is a mathematical game for reinforcing adding skills.

Object To reach the opposite side of the board with one playing piece, but only after having blocked at least one horizontal row on the hexagonal board.

Contents:

One hexagonal playing board
Two 12-sided, hexagonal" dice" containing numbers 1-12
50 White and 50 Black hex markers ("hexors")

60788.name: On the Right Track
60788.description:
On the Right Track is designed to be thought-provoking for soon-to-be released inmates, or newly released parolees. After playing the game, it should be clear that in order to successfully make it off parole, a person should take care of his or her responsibilities, keep employed, stay clean and sober, and avoid situations that could jeopardize freedom.

Winning the Game The Winner is the first person to make it off parole. It doesn't matter how much money you have left, or if you're flat broke. What's important is that you made it.

Contents:

One game board
Four colored markers
Twenty blue chance cards
Fifteen red chance cards
One die
Fifty bills of play money ($50 each)

60789.name: Black Out
60789.description:
The board game, Black Out, is an unusual survival. It was made during the Second World War in the UK, when materials were at a shortage and being used for other purposes. Therefore toys were made of cheap and poor quality materials. The subject matter used for this board game reflects its time and many children during the war loved to play war games. The playing pieces are represented by different vehicles that have to make their way across Central London during the imposed night-time blackout. This was when no lights could be showing so that night - time bombers would not see any targets.

The back of the board is completely back with a label with the name of the game and a silhouette image of the city of London. The playing side of the board is marked out with a street map with each corner named marble Arch, Holborn, Hyde Park Corner and Charring Cross. The edge of the board has a boarder with three stripes red, white and blue. The game has pack of cards and 4 playing pieces and instructions.

60791.name: Schiff ahoi!
60791.description: The game is played on a 12 x 7 grid. Each player has six ships and tries to sink the other player's fleet. A die determines how far a ship can move; the direction can be changed once per move. Islands and other ships are obstacles. If a ship hits another ship with the last point of the movement, that defending ship is sunk.

60792.name: Schnipsel-Jagd
60792.description: In this game, randomly one player takes a square-shaped tile; upturned - he/she must find the two matching halves as quickly as possible in an unsorted pile. The other players are playing a solitaire dexterity game at the same time. The first of the players reaching their individual goal scores a point. 10 points are needed for winning.

60793.name: Sonntagsspaziergang
60793.description: Simple roll and move game. The game contains 50 cards in three difficulty levels. When a player reaches certain fields, a question has to be answered, or the player simply has to move forward or back.

60794.name: Spaghetti
60794.description: Players take turns to roll a die. When a player rolls the color of his/her plate, he or she grabs a fork and tries to disentangle noodles of the corresponding color from the mess on the plate in the middle of the table. The others keep rolling at the same time; when another player rolls his/her color, he/she takes over the fork. The player with most noodles at the end of the game is the winner.

60795.name: Stop
60795.description: The game board is assembled from 56 street tiles. The players drive around in this network of roads. Each time they reach a colored dot, they have to answer a question correctly to get the question tile. The first player to get back to the start with at least 20 cards is the winner.

60796.name: Magimixer
60796.description:
A game of speedy equation creation.

Roll the dice-flower (a flower-shaped component showing two black dice and 5 white or colored dice) in the hand. The 5 white/colored dice must be used in an equation to equal the total of the 2 black dice.

Players must agree beforehand what types of operations are acceptable (eg. addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, square roots, etc) and players may use multiple operation types in a single equation.

The first player to create a correct equation wins. If there is no exact equation possible, then the first player to get the nearest possible answer wins.

60797.description:
From the Publisher: "A very exciting adventure! Sid, Diego, Manny and their friends are at the edge of a cliff, that may collapse at any moment. In this game you must move the characters from one spot to another without knocking down the entire board (along with the other characters)that hangs over the cliff. Luck, atention and balance await for you."

A dexterity game for kids based on the Ice Age 3 blockbuster from 20th Century Fox. On this game players roll two dice. The first tell you with character must be moved, and the second one the symbol of the spot to where that character must be moved to without knocking down the boards that hangs on a uneven surface. A nice dexterity game for kids.
60797.name: Jogo a Era do Gelo 3

60798.name: Engel - Grundregelwerk (revised)
60798.description:
In our far future, Earth has become the gigantic battlefield for the forces of good and evil. Vast Infernos scar the face of the planet with a dark mark, and the champions of the One Above wage a seemingly hopeless war against the unwholesome creatures of the Lord of the flies - the Dreamseed (Traumsaat).
Follow us.
Play your part in this saga.
Lead epic battles that rage across devastated Europe...
...and become Engel.

This book includes a set of Arcana cards

60800.description: Simple roll and move game running around a scoring track with characters from the Mickey Mouse Club.
60800.name: Mickey Mouse Club Game In Disneyland

60801.name: The Monster Game
60801.description: A create-a-monster style game that features different monster parts getting constructed in a 'chair' that brings the beast to life. Players follow along with their own parts on separate game pieces.

60802.name: WCW Action Wrestling
60802.description: A 'Skittles' style game that involves knocking down wrestler pieces and even has a referee. Comes with 9 wrestlers & 1 referee.

60803.name: Dish It Out: The Satellite TV Game
60803.description:
A cheaply made roll and move around the track game. Very unusual topic for a board game considering TV may very well be the number 1 enemy of the board game.

The object of the game is to race to the finish and the first player to reach the “win” arrow wins the game and can “dish it out” to his or her old TV antenna or cable service! With more than two players continue playing to establish second place, third place, etc.

60804.name: USA Egotrip: Vanity Plates Game
60804.description: A roll and move game in which you create your own personal license plate.

60805.description:
Panzertales: World Tank Division II (WTD II) is the sequel to WTD I. Published in Japan and written in Japanese, it is an area movement wargame focused on armored combat in 1944-45.

The game consists of three maps (two sheets printed front and back), cardboard counters, a rulebook and four unpainted PVC tanks (Tiger II, Panther, Hetzer and StuG IIIG). The maps depict the Normandy beaches, Remagen and Budapest. Counters depict armored vehicles for Germany, U.K., U.S.A., and U.S.S.R.

The game is a light wargame centered around the abstract depiction of armored combat in Europe late in the war. Obviously the intent of the game designers is for the players to equip themselves with World Tank Museum forces to use on the maps; the first four vehicles (all German) are a means to jump-start these forces. As these are generally insufficient, the included cardboard counters, which carry the attack strength, defense strength, movement value, etc., for the forces, can be used.

WTD II is a successor to WTD I, but is not exactly an expansion. Some minor changes to the forces have been made- e.g., point values for the units (which are used to build armies in design-your-own scenarios) have been adjusted. However, several new factors are introduced, such as the inclusion of infantry, anti-tank guns, armored personnel carriers, and rules for indirect fire/air strikes.
60805.name: Panzertales: World Tank Division II

60807.description: Spin and move game based on the classic story.
60807.name: The Game of the Three Bears

60808.name: O Casamento (Tagmar II Edition)
60808.description:
Translated from the book introduction:

The story has four distinct scenarios. On the first part of the adventure, the players meet and receive there mission: escort a young woman to the village of her love for their wedding.

But things go downhill when bad weather and mysterious things start to happen.

60809.name: O Arado de Ouro
60809.description:
User summary:

Welcome to the second adventure on the official line of Tagmar 2. "O Arado de Ouro" (The Golden plowshare) is a 5 parts adventure in where the players, after receiving a letter from priest Solônius, find themselves in the Calco County. Upon arriving the discover that the plowshare has disappeared along with their friend.

60810.name: A llha dos Corvos
60810.description:
User summary

The third adventure on the series, A Ilha dos Corvos (The Island of the Crows), is a direct continuation of the second adventure. Designed for 2-7 players on Stages 2 to 3. The players receive a tip from Bishop Solônius to help the Viscount of Litória. They are attacked by pirates and face bad weather that take them to the island.

60811.name: A Fronteira
60811.description:
Translated from the Book Introduction

Many of the information contained here are secret and unknown to all, men, elf or little ones; others are common knowledge, known to all and no mystery.

At south of Filanti, between the kingdoms of Luna, Marana and Verrogar, the name Fronteira (Frontier) is used by all the inhabitants of this peculiar region. Many mysteries and dangers lie here, more important on the Montes Palomares and in the Girond's Forest.

60812.name: White Dwarf (Issue 101 - May 1988)
60812.description:
From the cover:
"Games Workshop present their monthly games magazine"

CONTENTS

Culture Shock: Games Workshop diary of recent events

Illuminations: Profile of Russ Nicholson by John Blanche

Stratagems, Ruses and Ploys: Strategies for Warhammer Fantasy Battles by Peter Haines

Critical Mass: Dave Langford devours the latest book releases...

Letters: edited by Seam Masterson

Blanchitsu: Painter's problem page by John Blanche

Thrud the Barbarian: Part 2 of Thrud the Farmer by Carl Critchlow

Trouble at the Number 1 Inn: A RuneQuest 3rd edition scenario set on Griffin Island by John Quaife

Blood Bowl: The new edition of the fantasy football classic detailed by Marc Gascoigne

Left a Bit... Right a bit... Fire!: Orc artillery for Warhammer Fantasy Battles by Nigel Stillman

The Affair of the Hidden Jewel: A Warhammer FRPG scenario set at the edge of the Empire by Lewis Page

Chapter Approved: Resources for Warhammer 40K by Jervis Johnson and Rick Priestly

Cloneday Surprise!: A Paranoia scenario used a Gamesday '87, written by Bob Avery

'Eavy Metal: Painting shields and banners by John Blanche

Blood Bowl Competition: A chance to win 2nd edition Blood Bowl

Reader Survey

Index Astares: The uniforms and history of the Badab Uprising for Warhammer 40K by Rick Priestly

Another Brick in the Wall: New rules for Warhammer Siege by Nigel Stillman

Freebooters!: Freelance Bloodbowl players by Jervis Johnson - Cards included on the back cover

60813.name: A Vingança
60813.description:
User summary

On the the 5th adventure on the series, the players are surprised by a roadblock created by a revolt in an nearby city, and have to detour to a very small town to be search for someone to help them.

60814.name: The Tomb Complex of Nereshánbo
60814.description:
From the Front Cover

An adventure in the world of THE MAN OF GOLD

AN INTRODUCTORY LEVEL ADVENTURE ON THE WORLD OF TEKUMEL

Exotic Tekumel, a world of mighty empires, hostile non-humans, and ancient mysteries - the world of the Empire of the Petal Throne!

Not far from Jakalla lies the tomb of Nereshanbo, ancient wizard and servitor of Lord Ksarul, the Doomed Prince of the Blue Room. Its secrets have lain untouched for over a thousand years - are you and your fellow adventurers skillful enough to defeat the dangers of the Tomb Complex of Nereshanbo?

135939.name: Albion Triumphant Vol 1: The Peninsular Campaign

60815.description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the era of horse and musket 1700-1900.

If you can think of nothing finer than taking to the field of battle to refight great battles such as Quatre Bras, Bunker Hill, Rourke’s Drift, Blenheim, Gettysburg, and more, you’ll be needing a copy of Black Powder.

Black Powder is very much a game for gentlemen gamers. Gamers who cherish the finer things in life such as wonderfully painted armies, fighting over luxurious terrain and doing so in the company of friends. No need for the use of protractors to wheel a unit. Arguments over whether a charge is 2mm out of range are not something you’ll need to worry about. In essence it’s a very relaxing game that can produce stunning conflicts - conflicts that can see one side appear doomed only for them to pull victory from the icy grasp of Mistress Defeat!

The book itself is glorious. Hardback covers binding 184 full-colour pages filled with atmospheric anecdotes and the most sumptuous photographs of model soldiers you will have seen. It’s every wargamer’s dream!
60815.name: Black Powder

60817.name: Torero
60817.description:
A torero and a bull are fighting in an arena. The bull wins if it can run into the flag (which represents the torero) from behind, the torero wins if the bull runs into the flag from the side.
The bull can move 5 squares; the torero only one. The squares on the board have colors though, some colors restrict the movements.

60818.name: Spycraft Declassified: Odd Jobs
60818.description:
From the book:

Spies like to joke about the boogiemen in the shadows and the spookshow they play out for flag and future… But what if they’re only part wrong? What if there really is something to fear in the dark? What if the spooks in the shadows are actually something more or less than human? Here, for the first time in print, is everything you need to answer these and many other questions in your campaigns.

Spycraft Declassified: Odd Jobs collects the strangest and most fantastic of Crafty Games’ PDFs and Signs & Portents articles, including classic Greek and fantasy races from Origin of the Species, sanity-blasting cosmic horror and advanced stress rules from Fragile Minds, a new capsule setting that can take you literally anywhere you want to go, a new agenda for World on Fire that’s out of this world, and a ready-to-play adventure! Take your game in a whole new direction with this wild new Spycraft expansion.

60819.name: Back to Basics
60819.description:
From the back of the book:

Back to Basics is a drag-and-drop modification that replaces Spycraft 2.0’s base classes with basic classes, six new 20-level classes based on the Modern SRD, each of which corresponds to one of the 6 attribute types the Strong Hero, the Fast Hero, the Tough Hero, the Smart Hero, the Dedicated Hero, and the Charismatic Hero. These rules present an alternate class format and a looser class structure for the Spycraft system, allowing players greater control over their character’s abilities and progression and expanding upon the format begun in the Modern System Reference Document (SRD).

What’s Different from the Modern SRD?
Though Spycraft basic classes are founded upon the Modern SRD, they vary from the material in that document in several ways, including:

Core Abilities! Basic classes offer core abilities at their first level, just like standard Spycraft characters.
More Levels! Basic classes feature 20 levels instead of 10, allowing characters to pursue a single class path his entire career.
More Abilities! Basic classes gain a class benefit at every level, granting characters a bonus for achieving each level in every class.
More Options! Back to Basics characters may choose from 40 knack trees more than twice the options presented in the Modern SRD. Nearly half of these knacks are available to more than one class, offering players many more ways to hone their character concepts in play.
New Options! Many knack trees found in Back to Basics present entirely new options and ability styles, rather than rehashing the talent trees of the Modern SRD in a different format. Players familiar with both Modern SRD games and Spycraft will find that this modification offers a host of new play options and game ideas.

60820.name: Bag Full of Guns: This is My Rifle
60820.description:
From the publisher:

"This is My Rifle" is the first in the Bag Full of Guns series of Toolkits the Spycraft 2.0 roleplaying game, dedicated to bringing the finest, funkiest, and just-plain-coolest weapons to your Spycraft 2.0 tables. This supplement tackles the cutting edge infantry small arms in use and development by the U.S. military, including the the H&K XM8 Modular Carbine System, FN Special Forces Capable Assault Rifle (SCAR), FN Enhanced Grenade Launcher Module (EGLM), XM26 Lightweight Shotgun System, and the infamous Objective Individual Combat Weapon (OICW)! Inside you'll find all the rules you need to bring these deadly weapons to bear in the Spycraft 2.0 system, as well as new weapon qualities, ammunition, upgrades and more!

60821.name: Bag Full of Guns: Red Heat
60821.description:
From the publisher:

Red Heat is the second installment in the Bag Full of Guns series of Toolkits for Spycraft 2.0, dedicated to bringing the finest, funkiest, and just-plain-coolest weapons to your Spycraft 2.0 tables. This supplement details a baker’s dozen of innovative weapons from the Soviet Union and Russia, including ballistic knives, automatic pistols, silent assault rifles and revolvers, underwater firearms, the newest generation of hard-hitting Russian small arms, and more! Secret agents looking for weapons with superior stealth and armor penetration abilities, or Game Controls looking for more contemporary weapons to arm their minions with need look no further! Inside you'll find all the rules you need to bring these deadly weapons to bear in the Spycraft 2.0 system, including new weapon qualities, detailed descriptions, and more!

60822.name: The Big Score
60822.description:
From the publisher:

Tired of turning in your gear after every mission? Running a game with no home office? Just want to kill things and keep their stuff? No problem! The Big Score presents three all-new system upgrades that completely change the way you handle Spycraft gear! Now you can play that apocalyptic or mercenary game you've been considering and track your character's personal hoard every step of the way. Or you can raid a few dungeons or arcologies with cold, hard cash on the line. Collect relics, ancient baubles, and other incredible items built right into the setting and story. There's a gear option for every game in town - just choose a base system, decide whether to add Loot, and away you go!


The Stockpile system converts all your gear picks to Possessions so you can play an uninterrupted campaign with otherwise default rules.



The Cash n' Carry system lets you play with a traditional cash economy.



The Loot system introduces special prizes your characters can track down and win as mission objectives.



Detailed statistics for modern Common Items, including all kits in the Spycraft 2.0 Rulebook.



New gear-related campaign qualities and events.



Three new sheets for tracking your gear.

60823.name: Bag Full of Guns: This is My Gun
60823.description:
From the publisher:

"...This is My Gun" is the third in the Bag Full of Guns Toolkit series for the Spycraft 2.0 roleplaying game, and a sequel to the best-selling This is my Rifle... It presents the latest and greatest innovations of the U.S. military, including Dragon Skin armor, the Auto-Assault 12 machine shotgun, the XM-109 Objective Sniper Weapon, the Land Warrior and Interceptor Body Armor systems, the deadly Kriss Super V .45 SMG, and more! Inside you'll find all the rules and supporting material you need to neuter the enemy with superior firepower, as well as with new upgrades, ammunition, and gadgets!

60824.name: Agent X: One-Man Army
60824.description:
From the publisher:

One-Man Army is the first installment of the Agent X Toolkit series, bringing new and exciting classes and supporting character options to your game! It presents an indomitable, two-fisted force of nature, the ultimate action hero designed to plow through all opposition with blood on his hands and a satisfied grin across his face. Also included is the new Partner feat tree, giving any team the edge against even the most insurmountable odds. Pound someone to paste today!

60825.name: Agent X: The Runner
60825.description: The Runner is the second installment of the Agent X Toolkit series, bringing new and exciting classes and supporting character options to your game! An homage to the classic heroes of cyberpunk fiction, this expert data-thief takes his hacking out into the street, infiltrating impenetrable facilities to liberate information no matter who stands in his way. Also included are 3 new Tradecraft feats to help keep any agent off the grid and in the shadows. Grab your mirrorshades and start running today!

60826.name: Bag Full of Guns: Dragon's Fury
60826.description:
From the publisher:

Dragon's Fury is the fourth in the Bag Full of Guns Toolkit series for the Spycraft 2.0 roleplaying game, presenting an in-depth look at modern China’s cutting edge weaponry. It includes weapons of every size and class: the quirky Type 77 handgun series, the sleek Type 05 submachine gun, the QLT-89 silent mortar, the WJG-002 laser rifle (really!), and more! All the details and all the rules you need to field these uniquely deadly arms are included, along with new qualities, ammunition, and upgrades!

60827.name: Agent X: Firebrand
60827.description: Firebrand is the third installment of the Agent X Toolkit series, bringing new and exciting classes and supporting character options to your game! It presents a fiercely charismatic crusader whose monumental will can sway armies, undermine agencies, and topple entire governments. Also included is the new Camaraderie feat tree, which transforms a character's deep conviction into incredible offensive and defensive combat abilities.

60828.name: Spellbound: The Channeler
60828.description:
Spellbound introduces Sorcery for Spycraft 2.0 and expands on the magic in Fantasy Craft. It presents a collection of magical Schools, each an iconic approach to magic as seen in myth, folklore, and fiction, and incorporates spells seen in the d20 System Reference Document (SRD) and many other sources. Each Spellbound release focuses on a School and a corresponding base class. Spellbound products may be used individually or together, letting you customize magic to your taste.

This volume offers the Channeler, a martial powerhouse whose mastery of the elements, wild energy, and force magic is second to none. Along with the Channeler base class, this product offers new feats, character creation and campaign guidance, new NPC qualities and sample NPCs, and over 100 spells, including...

Burning Hands, Chaos Hammer, Cone of Cold, Continual Light, Control Weather, Feather Fall, Fireball, Fly, Knock, Levitate, Lightning Bolt, Mage Armor, Reverse Gravity, Shatter, Shout, Telekinesis, Shocking Grasp, Spiritual Weapon, Unseen Servant, many Wall spells, and more!

Spellbound is your gateway to unlimited magical adventure. Step through and claim the power of ages!

60829.name: Spellbound: The Seer
60829.description:
From the publisher:

Spellbound introduces Sorcery for Spycraft 2.0 and expands on the magic in Fantasy Craft. It presents a collection of magical Schools, each an iconic approach to magic as seen in myth, folklore, and fiction, and incorporates spells seen in the d20 System Reference Document (SRD) and many other sources. Each Spellbound release focuses on a School and a corresponding base class. Spellbound products may be used individually or together, letting you customize magic to your taste.

This volume offers the Seer, a classically trained master of old lore whose knowledge of events near and far, command of the ancient words of power, and keen understanding of complex devices guide him through even their darkest hour. Along with the Seer base class, this product offers new feats, character creation and campaign guidance, a new combat action, new NPC qualities and sample NPCs, and over 100 spells, including...

Anti-Magic Field, Command, Find the Path, Identify, Mind Probe, Permanency, Power Words, Read and Write Magic, Scrye, Telepathic Bond, Tongues, True Seeing, True Strike, Wish, construct summoning spells, detection spells, and more!

Spellbound is your gateway to unlimited magical adventure. Step through and claim the power of ages!

60830.name: Origins of the Species: Light of Olympus
60830.description:
From the publisher:

Origins of the Species is your destination for non-human races in Spycraft. Each installment in this series of toolkit products contains everything you need to incorporate a collection of fantasy or futuristic, mutant, or mythological races into your Spycraft games. These character options are timeless and setting-free, allowing you to drop them into any location, society, or backdrop. All that’s required is GC approval that they fit within the cosmology of the world!


Play as a mythical Centaur, Faun, Gorgon, or Triton!



Dozens of Species feats allow you to play as distinct sub-races or master the gifts of your people without having to suffer level penalties or XP restrictions.



Legendary Master Classes allow you to unlock the greatest powers of your race!



A complete cast of NPCs let you populate your setting quickly and easily.



New Character Seeds help you get off to a great start!

60832.name: Origins of the Species: Classic Fantasy
60832.description:
From the publisher:

Origins of the Species is your destination for non-human races in Spycraft. Each installment in this series of toolkit products contains everything you need to incorporate a collection of fantasy or futuristic, mutant, or mythological races into your Spycraft games. These character options are timeless and setting-free, allowing you to drop them into any location, society, or backdrop. All that’s required is GC approval that they fit within the cosmology of the world!


Play as one of the Big Four: Dwarf, Elf, Orc, and the lovable, precocious Pech!



Dozens of Species feats allow you to play as distinct sub-races or master the gifts of your people without having to suffer level penalties or XP restrictions.



Legendary Master Classes allow you to unlock the greatest powers of your race!



A complete cast of NPCs let you populate your setting quickly and easily.



New Character Seeds help you get off to a great start!



Your first real look at the upcoming Fantasy Craft print product!

60833.name: Origins of the Species: Transmechs
60833.description:
From the publisher:

Origins of the Species is your destination for non-human races in Spycraft 2.0. Each installment in this series of toolkit products contains everything you need to incorporate a collection of fantasy or futuristic, mutant, or mythological races into your Spycraft games. These character options are timeless and setting-free, allowing you to drop them into any location, society, or backdrop. All that’s required is GC approval that they fit within the cosmology of the world!

Play a giant transforming robot, hidden in the world of mortals!
Dozens of Species feats allow you to play as different transmech models and improve your transformations without having to suffer level penalties or XP restrictions.
A Legendary Master Class unlocks the greatest powers of your species!
A complete cast of NPC Transmechs and a black-book government organization help you quickly and easily populate your setting.
Tips for building an effective transmech character and three ready-to-play scenes for introducing these technological wonders to your campaign!

60834.name: Night of the Living Dead
60834.description: Night of the Living Dead is a conflict simulation of the George Romero and John Russo 1968 cult horror classic movie done as tribute to the genius of the "grandfathers of the genre." The game begins with the scene after the small group of people have joined together to defend themselves in an isolated southern farm against a growing mob of menacing "things" at dusk, and play continues until dawn. Night of the Living Dead is a two-player game, or it can be played solitaire.

60835.name: Another One Night Stands: The Florida Adventures
60835.description:
From the back of the book

Hi again and welcome to the SuperBabes Another One Night Stands! These are mini-modules designed to be one night adventures that can easily fit into your existing campaign or will work well as starting games to bring new groups together. After all, "You all meet in a bar" doesn't work very well for superheroic games. So with that in mind, we've designed some quickie adventures including character sheets. Most of the conceptual work has been done for you; all you have to supply are a few stats, some scenery and players, and you're ready to play. We hope you enjoy these short adventures, and we'd like to hear what you think.

60837.name: Thrones of Punjar
60837.description:
From the back of the book

Twisted secrets rise and give birth to horrors in the dark crevices beneath Slaughterstone Alley. When the city's greatest nobles srike bargains with abominations, and willing cultists offer up blood sacrifices in the name of their wicked masters, it will take both cunning and courage to face down the dark fiends that sit atop...

the Thrones of Punjar.

This stand-alone adventure can be played individually or as the sequel to DCC #053: Sellswords of Punjar and DCC #056: Scions of Punjar.

An adventure for character levels 7-9.

60839.name: Duplexity
60839.description:
A time jump has gone bad. Now there are two copies of you: You, and your evil twin from a parallel dimension! Eliminate your evil twin before he or she eliminates you. In Duplexity, you travel through time and space and manipulate the timestream to erase all trace of your opponent. Sacrificing time-clones of yourself, although not desirable, may be necessary.

The board has eight physical locations. Each physical location has five temporal locations: the far future, near future, present, recent past, and distant past. There are two more temporal locations: the unknown future and the permanent past. Each turn is divided into phases. Early in the turn, the players get to move and alter the state of the board. Later in the turn, time moves from the future toward the past. This means that anything in a:

distant past version of a physical location moves into the permanent past and off the board
recent past version of a physical location moves into the distant past version of the same location
present version of a physical location ***copies itself*** into the recent past version of the same location
near future version of a physical location moves into the present version of the same location
far future version of a physical location moves into the near future version of the same location




The layout of the board, combined with the mechanics for the progression of time are the critical elements for representing time travel in the game.

60840.name: Rabbit and Carrot
60840.description:
The game consists of a bell and a deck of cards (60). The cards are of a few different types:
- Carrots, one to three (possibly partly eaten)
- Rabbits, one to three
- Super rabbit
- Rabbit, hand clap
- Rabbit, hands up

The players divide the cards evenly among themselves and put the bell in the middle of the table. They then take turns to put one card face up on the table, each one in their own pile around the bell. When the number of uneaten carrots and rabbits are equal, players should ring the bell as fast as possible. Whoever does this first gets all the cards. The winner is the player who manages to collect all the cards. A player with no cards is not out of the game; he can still hit the bell first and get new cards. If a player hits the bell incorrectly, he has to give one card to each other player.

When the super rabbit comes up, hit the bell as fast as possible regardless of the other cards. When the other two special rabbits come up, players have to hit the bell and then clap their hands and/or raise their hands to win.

60841.name: CyberSkelter
60841.description:
From the back of the book:

Shards of glass and metal spin away from the vid-phone booth as hundreds of exploding rounds are pumped into it by black- and silver-clad bikers.

The interior of the nightclub is quickly transformed into a volcanic nightmare as the sound of the bikers’ detonating ammunition drowns out the club’s already ear-splitting musical onslaught. Patrons, garbed in psychedelic fashions, rush the exits. But they’re too late. A fire fight erupts throughout the building, splattering dancers, drinkers, bodyguards and bikers across the club’s walls and tables.

It’ll be another high body count night in the Sprawl.

This Cyberventure Mission File provides you with four linked adventures forming an extended cyber campaign. Starting off with a tough knock-off job in San Francisco, characters are swept into a series of adventures which take them from Berlin to Bombay. Several NPCs and organizations which debuted in previous Cyberspace' products find their way into the pages of Cyberskelter. Cyberskelter provides you with everything you'll need to run the following scenarios:

- Cooking With Fats
- Berlin Tear Down
- The Twitch
- Izabella

Cyberventure Mission File #3

60842.name: Vulkan-Ausbruch
60842.description: The game board is an island with a volcano crater in the middle. Each player tries to build a temple on his/her side of the island. For that, he/she draws a temple component out of a bag. The components are numbered 0 to 3. The component is set up and the corresponding number of red balls is put into the crater. When the crater is too full, the volcano erupts and the balls pour out, destroying much of the temples. The remains can be used again, while everything that fell down is removed. The first player to complete a temple is the winner.

60843.name: Waagemut
60843.description:
The board is a see-saw with five extensions. Each of these has six holes. Players take turns to add weights to the holes without the see-saw hitting the table. The further out the weights are, the more points they count (1-6). Also, other player's pieces can be "caught" by placing another weight on top, thus doubling the score.

The game was originally published by Parker, then re-issued by Schmidt as Waage-Mut in 1982 in a smaller version.

60844.name: Was fehlt?
60844.description: Each player has a walled garden. in which he/she places 4 picture tiles. Then the other player can have a look before the walls are set up again and one tile is removed. Finally, both players look at the opponent's garden again and try to be the first one to put one of their five pawns onto the missing picture on a larger board. The first player to get rid of all five pawns is the winner.

60845.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 115 - May 2006)

rpgissuearticle.85279: Back Room at the Games Pit

60845.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #115
May 2006

I Shall Fear No Stevil

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

60846.name: The Lady's Rock
60846.description:
From the publisher:

The Lady's Rock is the default campaign setting for the d10 System.

The human empire has ruled the "known world" for more than 2000 years. It has maintained the delicate peace for almost a millennium. Now a new enemy has come to the empire. Implacable minotaur raiders in their fierce draconian aether-ships have landed on the shores of the empire. In their wake they bring destruction, wholesale slaughter, and proof that the empire is no longer alone.

This unique setting has all the things you would expect from a campaign setting, and a few that you never saw coming. Coupled with the innovative d10 System, it's a game that's kept us entertained and promises to do the same for you.

60847.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 114 - Apr 2006)

rpgissuearticle.85221: Back Room at the Games Pit

60847.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #114
April 2006

Cool Hack Luke

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

60848.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 113 - Mar 2006)

rpgissuearticle.85174: Back Room at the Games Pit

60848.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #113
March 2006

Squirrelous Gorge

Cover art by Jolly R. Blackburn.

60849.name: Rook's Haven
60849.description:
From the publisher:

It has been called “The Jewel of the North” by those who have never ventured out of the grand bazaar and the inns of the Foreign Quarter.

Others call it “The City of Vice and Depravity.” What do they expect from a city founded by pirates and populated by the dregs of society?

Rooks’ Haven holds something for everyone. After all, if someone is willing to pay for it, chances are good that it can be found in “The City of Dark Delights.”

In a city where thieves and assassins rub shoulders with the heirs of nobility, adventure lurks around every corner.

You don't have to go looking for it...

Some how, it always finds you...
Rooks' Haven is the first campaign supplement for the Lady's Rock. It details a metropolis that can truly be described as a "wretched hive of scum and villainy," to steal a phrase from an incompetent member of a ancient mystic brotherhood of warrior monks that was destroyed and then almost completely forgotten in the span of 30 years.

It's leaders are corrupt, and make no attempt to appear otherwise. It's citizens are thieves, liars, and whores... and many of them are proud of that fact. It is a depraved city that it indifferent to life, human or otherwise. But somewhere in the depravity lies a freedom that you cannot find in civilized lands. It is that freedom that draws people to the Lady's Rock like moths to a flame.

60851.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 112 - Feb 2006)

rpgissuearticle.85827: Back Room at the Games Pit

60851.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #112
February 2006

Blackhands Down

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.
